content: Baidu stock surged Monday as an investment bank upgraded shares of the Chinese search engine, but turned more cautious on Chinese internet services Alibaba Group (BABA) and Tencent Holdings (TCEHY).KeyBanc Capital Markets analyst Hans Chung upgraded Baidu (BIDU) stock to overweight from sector weight. He sees "near-term headwinds" for Alibaba and Tencent. He kept his overweight rating on the three Chinese internet stocks.His quarterly review of the Chinese internet market left him incrementally more positive on fundamentals at Baidu. He set a price target on the stock at 305.Baidu stock jumped 4.1% to 261.97 on the stock market today. Alibaba rose 0.2% to 192.72, while Tencent popped 2.3% to 50.93.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseChung based his upgrade on Baidu on improved prospects for the company's core business in the near to midterm. That includes improved monetization of search queries and a ramp of ad revenue from its news feed.Meanwhile, he lowered his sales and earnings targets for Alibaba and Tencent. Both saw June e-commerce sales come in below expectations, Chung said.RELATED:As China Enters Bear Market, Do Some China Stocks Bear Watching?Baidu Stock Slips Despite Buyback, Spinoff iQiyi PlungesFord, Baidu Will Collaborate On AI-Infused, Connected Cars In China

The decision to sell a stock depends on your time frame. Where position trading looks at holding a stock for a couple of months, swing trading focuses on just a couple of weeks. The shorter trade requires more sensitive sell rules. That extra sensitivity led us to sell Alibaba stock on IBD's SwingTrader but hold Alibaba on IBD's Leaderboard.The traditional buy point on Alibaba (BABA) showed a 201.60 entry from a double-bottom base. An early entry presented itself as the stock hit resistance multiple times around 200. We added Alibaba to IBD's SwingTrader on May 25 as the price crossed that area, but it didn't hold above it by the close (1). The next day, Alibaba challenged the price level again but failed (2). With the market still trading flat, we took half the position off the table as a cautionary measure.A few days later, the stock recovered and cleared its traditional buy point (3). Buying the shares back would be an option at this point. The relative strength line cleared new highs more definitively (3) than at our original buy (1). But volume was a little light for a traditional breakout and the market was just starting to regain steam.Alibaba continued to make progress and reached our 5% profit goal as it crossed 210 (4). Normally, this would trigger our rule to sell half the position. In this case, since we only had a half position, it changed the math. That would leave us with a quarter-position size. It's hard to make much impact when your position size gets too small. You can also fall into the trap of ignoring losses because they are smaller and holding stocks longer than necessary. We decided to hold Alibaba early in the day for a 10% profit goal. We still raised our stop to 1% profit from our entry. But, we saw another bearish reversal (4) by the close leaving us less certain.The following day, Alibaba didn't participate in a strong market move and we removed the remaining shares around 208 (5). The change in character was enough to suggest that the stock might struggle over the next few days. That's not something you want to sit with in a swing trade. For a position trade, the decision could be different. That's why the stock stayed on IBD's Leaderboard at the time. Different sell rules apply to swing trades over position trades.IBD'S TAKE: IBD's Leaderboard is already up over 21% year-to-date while the S&P 500's gain is under 4%. Alibaba is one of 11 stocks on the Leaders List. Trial subscriptions are available. The decision to sell Alibaba stock worked well for the swing trade. The next day it was down nearly 3% closing well below its 5-day moving average line (6). More than a week later and it's still trading around the same level as our sell. As for Leaderboard, the stock is still contributing to profits there. Its relative strength line is still holding up and Alibaba got support at its 10-day moving average line. Its fundamental story of retail dominance in China is compelling. The different sell decisions may prove to both be correct for their respective time frames.More details on Past Trades are accessible to subscribers and trialists to SwingTrader. Free trials are available.RELATED:Swing Trading Versus Position Trading: When To Take ProfitsWhich Moving Average Is Best For Profiting On Swing Trades Swing Trading Strategies And Lessons

China has been dogged by growth concerns in recent months, but U.S.-listed China-based firms, particularly those that cater to China's booming internet population, aren't suffering from lack of growth.Far from it, actually, as Chinese stocks like Alibaba (BABA), Sina (SINA) and Weibo (WB), among others, continue to produce blockbuster earnings and sales.Bookmark this page to stay on top of the latest movers and shakers in China, with ongoing coverage of other industry leaders and disruptors like NetEase (NTES), Yum China (YUMC), Baozun (BZUN) and JD.com (JD).Get instant access to more trading ideas, exclusive stock lists and IBD proprietary ratings for only $5.RELATED:Best Stocks To Buy And Watch

China's mainland stock markets ended their first week fully in bear market territory on Friday, as Shanghai joined Shenzhen in pulling back more than 20% from February highs.Chart damage across the landscape of China-based stocks trading in the U.S. was significant. Leaders including Alibaba Group Holdings (BABA), New Oriental Education & Technology (EDU) and Autohome (ATHM) stabbed below support in heavy trade. Others, like Baidu (BIDU) and YY Inc. (YY), also broke support but in weak trade and therefore inflicting less damage on their charts.For several, including Baozun (BZUN), iQiyi (IQ) and CLPS (CLPS), the week's losses may have been a positive.China markets have fallen largely in response to the trade brawl underway as the U.S. attempts to restructure its international trade agreements. The tit-for-tat threat of sanctions between the two countries, and similar skirmishes underway between the U.S. and various other trading partners, has created the kind of volatile environment that is hostile to investor confidence.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseVarious types of institutional investors seek shelter in safe havens that can include the dollar, the Japanese yen, gold and Treasury bonds. That flight to safety helps drive currencies such as China's yuan lower. After a tough week, the yuan staged a modest rebound on Friday. But it was still set for its largest monthly decline on record, losing about 3.3% of its value vs. the dollar in June, according to Reuters.China Shenzhen Composite entered a bear market on June 19, as it fell more than 20% below its November high. The Shanghai Composite slipped into bear territory on Tuesday. Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index pulled back to a Thursday low that was 15.8% below its January high. That left it well above the 20% drop that defines a bear market.In response, U.S. investors have backed away from China-based names as indicators suggest things may get worse before U.S. trade strategy begins to bear any real fruit. U.S.-based stocks with China exposure also continue to suffer. Caterpillar (CAT) dropped more than 10% in June. Deere (DE) fell more than 5%. Boeing (BA) held to a loss of less than 4%.But the declines may also produce some opportunities worth watching. Two of those are IPOs.IQiyi dropped almost 11% for the week, its second steep weekly decline. The divot looks severe. But the pullback marked its low at 34.6% below its June 19 high. That leaves it within the 35% boundary of what is usually considered to be a normal pullback for cup-type bases. The stock remained up 57% since clearing an IPO base in May. But it has yet to form a standard base.The chart for another IPO, Huya (HUYA), looked similar at the end of the week. The pullback from its high was 41%, however. That means any base it builds will be a risky bet at breakout time.Financial IT services provider CLPS may be ready to form a base. The stock has nearly doubled since clearing an IPO base in mid-June.Baozun pulled back more than 10% for the week, but managed to keep close to its 10-week moving average. The stock could shape a base, or it could rebound from support at its 10-week line. In either case, Baozun's last breakout was from a third-stage base. That's not a late-stage stock, but does face additional risk.Get instant access to more trading ideas, exclusive stock lists and IBD proprietary ratings for only $5.RELATED:Will China's Artificial-Intelligence Push Buckle Trump's Tech Wall?IBD Stock Of The Day: This Hot Energy Stock Is Near New Buy PointCloud Services Propel Fintech Software Firms To Higher ValuationsChinese Stocks: Latest News & Analysis

The bear market is back in China, but should that matter to U.S. investors? On Friday, the Shanghai Composite dropped to 20.9% off its Jan. 29 high. Traditionally a 20% decline is the definition of a bear market.IBD's Stock Spotlight screen offers a partial answer to the who-cares question. Going into Tuesday's session, only one China-based stock made the screen: Alibaba (BABA).Earlier this year, as the Shanghai peaked, as much as 25% of the Spotlight lineup was China-based stocks.Individual investors might argue that the 2015-16 bear market in China meant little to U.S. investors. From a peak in June 2015 to a low in January 2016, the Shanghai Composite lost about half of its value. Meanwhile, U.S. indexes dropped less than 10% in the same period.Still, a decline is nothing to cheer about, especially since circumstances today are different.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseIn the 2015-16 China bear market, the chief bearish driver was slowing economic growth in China. Now President Trump's trade war is the chief catalyst.Let's take a look at the nine China-based stocks that have made the Spotlight screen at least once this year. What can their relative absence tell us now?No. 1: Online marketplace Alibaba is 10% off its high, not bad vs. the Shanghai's 20% drop. Yet the stock lost its 10-week moving average Monday. China is trying to shift to a more consumer-based economy and Alibaba could benefit from those efforts.No. 2: Tutoring center operator TAL Education (TAL) has made the Spotlight screen for more weeks this year than any other China stock. But after hitting a new high June 12, the stock has fallen 21% off its high. The last few bases were late-stage patterns.No. 3: Express delivery provider ZTO Express (ZTO) is 9% off its high. Action appears normal, even positive. The 2016 IPO recently found support at its 10-week line. The up-down volume ratio is a bullish 2.1, above the neutral 1.0 level.No. 4: Hotel chain Huazhu Group (HTHT) is 11% off its high after trimming gains from its May 15 breakout. The relative strength line, which measures a stock's price movement vs. the S&P 500, is bending south.No. 5: Solar-related stock Daqo New Energy (DQ) is 51% off its high. Both the 10-week and 40-week lines have been lost.No. 6: Social networking platform Weibo (WB) is 35% off its high. It hasn't made the Spotlight screen since March.No. 7: E-commerce solutions provider Baozun (BZUN) is finding support at its 10-week line. This is the first trip to the line since Baozun broke out in May.No. 8: Online marketplace 58.com (WUBA) lost its 10-week line this week. The stock is 19% off its high.No. 9: Health care services company iKang Healthcare Group (KANG) is 1% off its high. The company has agreed to a merger.What can investors learn from the Spotlight lineup?Many of the above China-based stocks carry seriously damaged charts.ZTO's chart is probably the most promising for two reasons. First, it's newest to the Spotlight lineup, having appeared in two of the past four weeks. Second, it is holding above its 10-week line.ZTO could be a watch list candidate. If the Shanghai Composite can find a bottom and rise, and the U.S. indexes can shake off their problems, ZTO could become a winner.RELATED:Trump Threatens Harley-DavidsonIs Stock Market About To Relive 1930?Stocks That Are Showing Relative Strength?MarketSmith: 3 Weeks For $19.95

When top stocks break out, it's important to manage your expectations. Some stocks advance immediately and lead to solid gains, like Twitter (TWTR). Others, like Sector Leader Alibaba (BABA), require patience for a potential move to develop that can lead to a nice profit.XChinese top stock Alibaba shares the No. 1-ranking in the Retail-Internet group with a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating. The rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to gauge a stock's leadership potential.Other top stocks in the group — that hold 99 IBD Composite Ratings — include Leaderboard member Amazon.com (AMZN), Etsy (ETSY) and Stamps.com (STMP). All three are well-extended from recent buy points and just off new highs.Alibaba's latest quarter showed earnings growth of 44% vs. the year-ago period. Meanwhile, revenue grew 76% to accelerate for a second straight quarter. Analysts expect the company's earnings to increase 28% in fiscal-year 2019 (ending in March) and 34% in 2020.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseAccording to JPMorgan, Alibaba positions its Cainiao logistics business as one of the key connectors of its New Retail and New Manufacturing initiatives. The goal of New Logistics is to generate cost savings by eliminating inventories. The analysts have an overweight rating on the stock with a 230 price target.While the stock originally broke out May 29, Alibaba didn't gain steam until June 1's more than 3% advance in heavy volume. Now, the stock is treading water in the 5% buy range after a recent breakout above a double bottom's 201.60 entry. Shares were down 0.5% in midday trade Wednesday.On June 1, the stock's relative strength line hit a new high — inked in blue on every MarketSmith daily and weekly chart — confirming the stock's potential as a market leader.Also on that day, Alibaba became the IBD Stock of the Day, as the retail giant strengthens its grip on China's e-commerce market.RELATED:IBD Stock Of The Day: Chinese Internet Giant Powers Into Buy ZoneECB Meeting, Adobe Earnings, Retail Sales Lead Investing Action PlanIBD Stock Of The Day3 Stocks Near Buy Zones; Time To Take Profits In Twitter?

Cutting losses quickly is critical to success in swing trading. You must have a set stop loss and the discipline to act if it hits. With China trade war headlines jostling stocks, you need to know where to put your stop loss for the protection it provides.Baozun (BZUN) had a lot to offer as a swing trade opportunity. It's a member of the computer enterprise software group, one of the top-performing groups of this year. Its last earnings report acted as a catalyst for a strong breakout (1), vaulting 20% move in the next few weeks. Rather than fretting over the missed opportunity in Baozun's move, you can look for a new opportunity in a pullback. In this case, a bullish reversal presented itself as the stock fell below 60 then powered back above it in a single day (2).Typically in a reversal, we look for the price to surpass the previous day's close to confirm the strength. The reversal day fell short in that regard. But the next day, the stock opened above the reversal day high and started making progress early in the trading day (3). Baozun joined IBD's SwingTrader at an early entry of 62.36. But before entering a trade, you need to determine where to put your stop loss.For reversals, we often look to the low of the reversal day as our stop loss. In this case, that would amount to an excessive risk for a swing trade at nearly 10%. Using the low of the entry day would normally be an acceptable alternative, but that was too tight.There seemed to be an area of support around 60 from a few weeks back on the daily chart and this matched up nicely with an area of support on the intraday chart. At over a 3% risk percentage it was on the higher side but still reasonable. You could also reduce the risk to your portfolio by adjusting your position size.Two days later, short-term market conditions worsened and Baozun hit our stop loss (4). It's not fun taking a loss, but it is a part of trading. Sure, by the end of the day the stock was above our stop loss but you don't know if it will come back when your stop loss triggers. You have to protect yourself from the loss potentially growing.The China trade war rhetoric continued the next week and Baozun fell 10% the day after we removed it from SwingTrader. It continued falling throughout the week. If you don't respect your stop loss, you set yourself up for devastating losses.It's bad enough that you reduce the capital in your portfolio. It means starting with less money for your next opportunity. But even worse is what a large loss can do to your emotional capital. You can get more timid at the next move, investing less or investing late. That's the hidden cost of big losses. Cut losses short, respect your stop losses and it will save you from a lot of costly mistakes.More details on Past Trades are accessible to subscribers and trialists to SwingTrader. Free trials are available.Get instant access to more trading ideas, exclusive stock lists and IBD proprietary ratings for only $5.RELATED: What To Do When A Swing Trade Doesn't WorkCutting Losses Quickly Is Key To Long-Term Stock ProfitsSwing Trading Strategies And Lessons

Chinese top stocks tumbled Wednesday, despite the easing of trade war threats with China, which sent the Dow Jones industrials solidly higher. All three Chinese Sector Leaders — Baozun (BZUN), Momo (MOMO) and YY (YY) — are trading right at their 10-week moving average lines in the stock market today.XThe Sector Leader screen highlights the best stocks across IBD's 33 sectors.Baozun — covered extensively on Tuesday — continued to pull back after rising as much as 30% past a 52.43 buy point. That gain had entirely disappeared at its Wednesday lows, triggering a round-trip sell signal. The round-trip sell signal is designed to prevent a big gain from turning into a loss.According to the IBD Stock Checkup, Baozun has a 98 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating. The rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseMomo was on track to extend a losing streak to five sessions Wednesday. The social networking company has given back a substantial portion of its nearly 34% advance from a 40.55 cup-shaped base entry.Analysts expect the company's earnings to grow 42% in 2018 and another 25% in 2019.Social media platform YY traded about 6% lower Wednesday afternoon, as the stock continued to form a lopsided base. The stock is testing both the 50- and 200-day moving averages.The stock's relative strength line is drastically lagging, a bearish technical metric.Fellow Chinese top stock Alibaba (BABA) triggered the 7%-8% loss-cutting sell signal from a 201.60 double-bottom entry. Shares fell over 2% Wednesday, falling nearly to their 200-day moving average.Get instant access to more trading ideas, exclusive stock lists and IBD proprietary ratings for only $5.RELATED:NYSE's First Marijuana Stock, Paycheck To Report Earnings: Investing Action PlanBest Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchTop Stocks Break Down Amid Market Rout; Dow Jones' Home Depot Near EntryWill Grubhub, Amazon, Uber Crave What This 2016 IPO Now Delivers?

An investor who had bought all 10 of IBD's Global Leader stocks listed on Dec. 29 would have, as of Tuesday, a 10.3% profit.That is well above the S&P 500, but a tad behind the Nasdaq's 10.9% increase over the same period. All in all, it's an uninspiring performance for profit-seeking investors.But what if you had followed CAN SLIM rules and only bought stocks at valid buy points? That strategy would immediately knock off what turned out to be the two worst performers on the final Global Leaders list of 2017. Both were Argentina-based names. Grupo Financiero Galacia (GGAL) is down 27% for the year through Tuesday. Grupo Supervielle (SUPV) showed a 34% loss. Neither entered buy zones before starting their sell-offs.Eliminate those two and the year-to-date average for the remaining eight stocks jumps to 20.5%. But that is misleading. Some stocks didn't reach buy points for a while. Others on the list saw breakouts fail and triggered sell rules, before later recovering.CAN SLIM rules further pared the list by eliminating two China-based names. YY Inc. (YY) failed to form a proper base before beginning its sell-off in January. New Oriental Education (EDU) topped a buy point, but in such weak trade that it left doubts about the breakout.That left a total of five of the 10 Global Leaders that moved into buy ranges either late last year or in January. Two of those five breakouts, Alibaba Group (BABA) and China Lodging (HTHT), quickly failed and triggered automatic sell rules.But the CAN SLIM method would have caught and held onto the breakout of Autohome (ATHM) on Jan. 2. The stock was up 63% from the 67.79 buy point on Wednesday.The list's other big gainer, Atlassian (TEAM), would've been harder to hold. It broke out Jan. 16, but triggered a sell rule four weeks later. Investors had two chances to buy back in, as the stock retook that buy point in heavy volume in late February and early March. The stock was 26% above that entry on Wednesday.The average for the five stocks that passed buy points late last year and in January gives an average gain of 16.1%. That assumes a 7% loss for each of the two failed breakouts. In addition, it's probably safe to assume most investors would've sold India-based bank HDFC (HDB), as the stock lagged through the first quarter. A sale at the early March low of 95.05 would've produced a loss of 5%.That lowers the performance of the five "buy" stocks to 14.8%.But a CAN SLIM investor would also have followed some of the stocks into subsequent buys. Michael Kors (KORS) never quite reached its buy point in April. The stock immediately weakened, underscoring the importance of not buying before a buy point.China Lodging topped a 41.65 buy point in a cup base on May 15. It traded about 17% above the entry Wednesday. Two weeks later, IBD Leaderboard investors closely followed Alibaba's June 1 breakout above a 201.60 buy point. It gained as much as 4% but has erased the entire gain.That means an investor who opened $5,000 positions on each of the five "buy"stocks early in the year would now have grown those to $28,700. Also, that same investor could have invested cash freed from the early Alibaba, China Lodging and HDFC sales (minus 7% each for Alibaba and China Lodging, minus 5% for HDFC) in new positions.If the full $14,050 from those sales were invested, 50% in Alibaba and 50% in China Lodging, it would've grown to $14,963.It's not a knockout profit, but the simple strategy produced a combined total of $29,613 — an 18.5% gain. That comfortably outclasses the Nasdaq's 11.4% year to date gain through Wednesday, not to mention the S&P 500's 3.6% increase.Acacia, Lumentum Gain As U.S. To Lift Ban On ZTE Component SalesThe Robot Revolution Is Here, And Medicine Is Embracing ItAutohome Stock 'Ascends' Into Buy Zone Via This Rare, Bullish BaseAtlassian Bulls Focus On Customer Growth, Product InvestmentsChinese Stocks: Latest News & Analysis

Baidu (BIDU) stock fell even though the Chinese internet search leader announced a new $1 billion stock buyback over the next 12 months.New York-listed shares in the Chinese internet giant closed down 3.1% to 243 on the stock market today. Baidu's buyback is smaller than the two-year, $6 billion repurchase program announced by e-commerce firm Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) in 2017.Baidu said the repurchases will be funded from the company's existing cash balance. The internet company completed an earlier, $1 billion share buyback plan in 2016.Chinese tech companies in general announce fewer buybacks than U.S. counterparts, such as Apple (APPL), which face more shareholder pressure.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseBaidu stock is up 39% from a year ago while Alibaba has gained 33%. Chinese stocks have sold off recently amid fears of a trade war with the U.S.Baidu stock hit an all-time high of 284 on May 16. Shares fell after the company's chief operating officer, Qi Lu, announced he would be leaving. Shares in the internet search leader are now trading just below its 50-day-moving-average, a bearish signal.Baidu consolidates the financial results of iQiyi (IQ), a Netflix-like video streaming service. Baidu spun off iQiyi, which is unprofitable, in late March.The initial public offering raised $2.25 billion, with shares priced at 18. Shares in iQiyi surged to 44 on June 18 before retreating. China stocks Huya (HUYA), iQiyi (IQ) and Bilibili (BILI) are notable young companies in the hot online media industry that are seeing explosive growth in their share prices. If you're looking for a proper entry for these runaway stocks, you may soon be able to get your chance. Meanwhile, Momo (MOMO) is extended but not overheated.These hot China stocks are in the same industry groups as big-name U.S. internet companies. Huya and Bilibili are in the Internet-Content group along with Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL) and Facebook (FB), while iQiyi joins Netflix (NFLX) in the Leisure-Movies & Related group. Top stocks typically come from top industry groups. The Leisure-Movies & Related group is ranked No. 3 out of the 197 industry groups IBD tracks, while Internet-Content is ranked No. 11.IQiyi and Bilibili reversed lower Friday and dropped below their 10-day moving averages after being well-extended from that level. Meanwhile, Huya extended its gains Friday, though it backed well off its intraday high. At one point Friday, the stock was extended as much as 40% from its 10-day moving average.When a stock becomes 20% extended from its 10-day moving average, that's usually when pullbacks are seen. If these highflying stocks are able to consolidate, that could provide investors with fresh buying opportunities.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseHuya shares fell at Monday's open but rebounded to close up 5% on the stock market today. IQiyi vaulted 9.4% and Bilibili jumped 8.3%.All three stocks have made rapid moves since their IPOs earlier this year.Baidu (BIDU) spinoff iQiyi is up a whopping 95% since breaking out of an IPO base with a 20.60 buy point on May 10. IQiyi is known as the Netflix of China and it licenses some of its content from Netflix.Bilibili, a youth-focused media platform, is up 65% since breaking out of an IPO base of its own in May. Bilibili and iQiyi both debuted in late March.And Huya, a livestreaming platform for gaming in China, went public on May 11 as a spinoff of YY (YY), which is also a livestreaming company. The stock has yet to take an official breather, never forming a proper IPO base along its run. Shares have risen 285% from the IPO price of 12.As iQiyi, Bilibili and Huya are young names in China's growing internet marketplace, their growth stories still seem to be in the early stages. Huya is turning profitable, while Bilibili is expected to be profitable soon. And all three of these China stocks have already seen strong revenue growth. Looking at stocks that are in the early stages of growth is key to scoring big gains.China's Momo, which went public in December 2014, is well extended from its last proper buy point. But Momo is clinging closely to its 10-day moving average, unlike the three names above. The stock gapped up on May 29 after earnings and is now up 33% from a 40.55 cup entry. Momo stock fell 0.9% Monday.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Dow Jones Futures: These 5 Chip Stocks Are Near Buy PointsIBD Stock Of The Day: Hot New China IPO iQiyi Flashes This Key Technical SignChart Analysis: These 4 Top Stocks Are Trading Near Buy Points IBD Stock Of The Day Nears Buy With Earnings Growth Set To AccelerateBest Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchIPO Stock News And Analysis: Find Today's Top New Issues

Bitcoin crashed below the $8,000 mark Monday after Twitter (TWTR) confirmed it will ban cryptocurrency ads, joining Facebook (FB) and Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google in a crackdown.XAds promoting both digital currency initial coin offerings and token sales fall under the auspices of Twitter's restricted content policy in regards to financial services."We are committed to ensuring the safety of the Twitter community. As such, we have added a new policy for Twitter ads relating to cryptocurrency," the firm said in a statement Monday. "Under this new policy, the advertisement of Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) and token sales will be prohibited globally."Twitter will continue evaluate and update the policy as the industry evolves, the firm also said. Facebook issued a similar policy on Jan. 30, and Google made its change on March 14 amid concerns that crypto ads might rip off their users.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseLast week, Bitcoin plunged on reports that the social media platform was considering a ban on cryptocurrency-related ads, falling near the $7,000 level.On Monday, Bitcoin fell 6.1% to $7,937.40, according to Coindesk, and had reached as high as $8,980.99 on Saturday. Ethereum tumbled 9%. Bitcoin Cash dropped 7.1%. And Ripple, also known as XRP, retreated 7.6%.Shares of Twitter rallied 2.8% on the stock market today. Among Bitcoin-related stocks, Riot Blockchain (RIOT) was down 1.9%, Long Blockchain (LBCC) fell 1.8%, Marathon Patent Group (MARA) tumbled 6.3%, and Bitcoin Investment Trust (GBTC) sank 8.1%.Overstock.com (OSTK) gave up 1.3% to 44.60. But the stock tumbled about 8.5% in late trade as Overstock announced plans to issue four million shares.Meanwhile, stock in New York-based financial tech company Longfin (LFIN), whose stock swelled 2,600% after the company touted its ties to cryptocurrencies, plummeted nearly 17% to 59.28 after being attacked by activist short seller Andrew Left on Monday.Citron Research, which is run by Left, alleged in a tweet that the company is a "pure stock scheme.""If you are fortunate enough to get a borrow, indeed $LFIN is a pure stock scheme. @sec_enforcement should not be far behind. Filings and press releases are riddled with inaccuracies and fraud," the tweet said.However, Lijie Zhu, managing director at Longfin's investor-relations firm Dragon Gate Investment Partners, backed the stock."Citron is known as a short seller. He has no evidence," Zhu told CNBC. "There is no content for his report and we see no fraud as a third-party investor-relations firm."Longfin CEO Venkat Meenavalli was unavailable for comment Monday, but said in December that the company's several-billion-dollar cap was unjustified when the stock hit its record high of 142.82 on Dec. 18. It came just days after the firm announced it was acquiring Ziddu.com, a blockchain-focused firm which had zero revenue.But there was positive news on the digital currency front after Cboe Global Markets (CBOE) President Chris Concannon said the market could support the launch of a Bitcoin exchange traded product, or ETP.In a letter sent to the Securities and Exchange Commission, he cited data collected from the company's launch of Bitcoin futures late last year.In January, the SEC voiced concerns over investor protection and market fragmentation, but Concannon has claimed Bitcoin commodity markets "are developing quickly.""While the current Bitcoin futures trading volumes on Cboe Futures Exchange and CME (CME) may not currently be sufficient to support ETPs seeking 100% long or short exposure to Bitcoin, Cboe expects these volumes to continue to grow and in the near future reach levels comparable to those of other commodity futures products at the time that they were included in ETPs," Concannon said in his letter.He also stated that being able to invest in digital currencies through an ETP would "provide a more transparent and easily accessible vehicle for gaining such exposure."YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Before You Buy Bitcoin, Read ThisStill Bullish On Bitcoin? Read The Cautionary Tale Of This Blockchain StockBitcoin And Cryptocurrency News And TrendsHow To Invest In The Stock Market: Start With A Simple Routine

The cup-with-handle chart pattern is to serious investors what the single is to a baseball fan. It's the starting point for scoring runs and winning the investing game.Among the eight principal base patterns — including the flat base, double bottom, saucer, base on base, ascending base, IPO base, and high, tight flag — the cup with handle remains to this day one of the most successful.Why? Simple. Over the centuries, human nature hasn't changed. Greed, fear, hope, despair and other emotions drive stock prices. So do the laws of supply and demand.This is why sifting through the charts of the market's greatest winners is time well worth spent.As you'll see, the general shape of the cup with handle and other critical chart patterns appear over and over again. That's why they give the prepared investor an edge in the stock market. (You can sift through more than a century of history among the greatest stock market winners by going to the fourth edition of William O'Neil's classic, "How To Make Money In Stocks," and studying Chapter 1.)So let's dissect this base. This is something you should know inside out. You need to know if that cup with handle is as it should be, or if it has flaws.The stock needs to show a 30% uptrend from any price point, but it must be before the base's construction. Or, the stock must show a minimum 20% increase from a prior breakout.The cup with handle must be at least seven weeks long. If there is no handle, then the cup itself must stretch a minimum six weeks.The handle alone needs at least five days to form, but it could go on for weeks. Make sure it doesn't exceed the cup portion in time or size of decline. A good cup with handle should truly look like the silhouette of a nicely formed tea cup. The handle always shows a smaller decline from high to low; it represents a final shakeout of uncommitted holders, sending those shares into sturdier hands in the market.In most cases, the decline from high to low should not exceed 8% to 12%. During bear markets, some good cup with handle bases show a large, double-digit decline within the handle. But again, it should not exceed the drop within the cup.The handle usually begins with a down day in price. Be aware that the handle itself, which must stretch for a minimum five trading sessions, can morph into a base of its own in certain cases. That's not a problem; it's often a stock's way of offering a buy point that's clearer or lower than that suggested by the larger pattern.The handle should form in the upper part of the entire pattern. If it's too low, it's flawed.One way to check if that handle is proper: use the simple midpoint test. Add the highest price and lowest price within the handle and divide by 2. That number should be greater than the midpoint of the actual base itself.Let's take the cup with handle fashioned by Baidu (BIDU) (see the chart below) in 2007. In the cup base, the high was 134.10 and the low was 92.80. Add the two prices together and divide by 2 and you get a base midpoint of 113.45. The handle showed a high of 132.80 and a low of 120.25, and its midpoint of 126.53 easily exceeded the cup's midpoint.The handle should also show a downward slope along at least a portion of its price lows, not an upward one.An upward-sloping handle is flawed; it represents weak demand as new buyers move into the stock at a trickling pace. During the stock's actual breakout, you want to see a new wave of buyers coming in at a torrid pace, not a trickling one.Also, a steep, high-volume decline should put you on alert. You don't want to buy a stock that institutional investors couldn't wait to unload at any price.The cup should form smoothly, without major price declines on the left side. Sharp gains on the right side aren't necessarily good, either. You might think that the opposite of a panic-driven exit would be a good thing. Likely not.Try to limit your picks to cups that are no more than 30% or 33% deep, except for those built during a bear market. In that case, an exceptional growth stock can fall 40%, 50% or more and still make a successful breakout.Still, shallower is better. It shows that the big hands are catching the stock.Look for volume to dry up along the lows of the base. Volume should be light in the handle, too.Tighter price action is better. This is true of almost all bases. A loose, choppy base shows the stock needs to go far for price discovery. If institutions are holding on to the stock, it won't fall too far.This, of course, is where all the above parameters lead if they appear correctly. The buy point from a cup-with-handle base appears at the highest point of the handle, plus 10 cents. In the case of former big winner Baidu, the proper buy point during its May 14, 2007, breakout was 132.90, a dime above the handle's intraday high of 132.80.Less than six months later, the leading Chinese web search engine rocketed to 428, up 222%.Even if all other parameters come together, you should avoid stocks that break out below their 10-week moving average.Also, when the stock is breaking out, you should generally see a rush in turnover. Volume should ideally rise at least 40% above its 50-day average. For small and midcap stocks, expect breakout volume to double or triple.The daily and weekly charts at both Investors.com and MarketSmith make heavy turnover easy to spot. Simply compare the day or week's volume with the moving average line drawn across the volume bars. An Investors.com chart will also tell you in real time how volume is running in comparison with typical level at that time of the trading session.For the weekly chart, the moving-average line traces 10 weeks' worth of turnover.What should you do if volume on breakout day is much lighter than usual? Sometimes volume will pick up in the next few sessions. Light volume in the market in general may also be a factor. Also consider that the breakout may have started later in the day.O'Neil has often said at past IBD seminars that after a stock breaks out, he wants to see weekly volume rise vs. the prior week. This signifies a sudden shift in demand for shares that could continue to build up.Are quarterly results coming up? If so, traders often hesitate before the news. But if the stock fails to make much headway in price, the relative strength line is fading, and the market itself is not showing positive action then something may be wrong with the timing of the breakout.At that point, it makes sense to exit the stock, even if the 7%-8% loss-cutting sell rule has not yet been triggered.(Editor's Note: A version of this column was first published in the July 9, 2010, edition of IBD. Please follow Saito-Chung on Twitter at @IBD_DChung for more discussion and analysis of growth stocks, charts, breakouts, sell signals, and financial markets.)RELATED:Which Stocks in IBD Leaderboard Have Traced The Cup With Handle? Stocks Near A Buy ZoneFinding Hot Growth Stocks: A Peek Inside IBD 50Who Are The Current Sector Leaders?How To Find Superb Growth Stocks: Follow This Simple Routine

Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX) shares rocketed to a three-month high Friday after rival Galapagos (GLPG) released disappointing results for a cystic fibrosis treatment that led partner AbbVie (ABBV) to opt out of additional studies.On the stock market today, Vertex popped 15.2%, to 169.96. Shares of Galapagos tumbled 3.8%, to 92.18, though AbbVie stock lifted 0.3%, to 92.69. Broadly, biotech stocks rose about 1.5%.Galapagos tested its drug, GLPG2737, as a cystic fibrosis treatment for patients with a specific genetic mutation. The patients had already received Vertex's drug, Orkambi. But Galapagos' goal of showing its drug could be part of a triple-regimen in cystic fibrosis fell short.At day 28, patients treated with GLPG2737 showed a 3.4% improvement in lung function over those who received the placebo. That failed to hit statistical significance. It also trailed Vertex's data for its drugs VX-659 and VX-445, which showed benefits of 10%-11% and 12%-14%, respectively.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of Use"The bar remains high," Raymond James analyst Laura Chico said in a report. "With Vertex already advancing into Phase 3 pivotal studies with their triple regimens, we see few competitors that will be able to challenge Vertex in the near/intermediate term."Chico kept her outperform rating on the biotech company's stock.An improvement of 10% vs. the placebo would have been competitive, Credit Suisse analyst Vamil Divan said in a report. GLPG2737 is also being tested as part of a triple-regimen containing a pair of other drugs from Galapagos. But Divan is now bearish on that study, called Falcon.Thursday's "data raises significant concerns about Falcon and the competitiveness of the entire (cystic fibrosis) franchise," he said.Galapagos is partnered with AbbVie on its cystic fibrosis efforts. But AbbVie is "taking a knee in" cystic fibrosis, Raymond James' Chico noted. In a press release, Galapagos said AbbVie decided not to proceed with a previously contemplated second triple-regimen therapy.Now, "Galapagos is reviewing the future of its CF (cystic fibrosis) collaboration with AbbVie," the biotech company said in its release.The data release from Galapagos removes a major overhang on Vertex stock, RBC Capital Markets analyst Brian Abrahams said in a report. He expects Vertex to be "the dominant (cystic fibrosis) player for the foreseeable future."Abrahams expects the biotech company to hit out-year cystic fibrosis treatment sales of about $7.5 billion and $15 per share in earnings. He has a 202 price target on Vertex stock.Leerink analyst Geoffrey Porges has a 175 price target on Vertex. He noted Galapagos' cystic fibrosis treatment resulted in a sweat chloride reduction that was also materially lower than Vertex's results in its experimental triple-regimens. Sweat chloride is an indicator of cystic fibrosis."None of this is particularly surprising to us," he said in a report. "It should, however, serve as a reminder of the difficulty of doing complex multicompound drug development projects, and of the high wall around Vertex's future value in (cystic fibrosis)."Get instant access to more trading ideas, exclusive stock lists and IBD proprietary ratings for only $5.RELATED:Chart-Reading Basics: How A Buy Point Marks A Time Of Real OpportunityHow To Invest In Stocks For Free: New Apps Aim For BeginnersLong-Term Retirement Investing Strategies With ETFs

Dow Jones futures were little changed late Thursday, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures. President Donald Trump has approved a revised China tariffs list, according to multiple reports. Adobe Systems (ADBE) topped earnings views and guided higher, but its stock fell. AT&T (T) and Time Warner (TWX) rose late as the Justice Department won't seek to stay Tuesday's court ruling blessing their merger. Meanwhile, red-hot Chinese livestreaming IPOs iQiyi (IQ), Huya (HUYA) and Bilibili (BILI) extended big gains from the regular session.During the regular session, the Nasdaq composite rallied strongly to a new high, fueled by strong gains in FANG stocks such as Netflix (NFLX) and Facebook (FB), with software and internet IPOs (including iQiyi, Huay and Bilibili) continuing to shine. The S&P 500 index rose slightly, while the Dow Jones industrial average dipped as energy and retail stocks slumped.Dow Jones futures were essentially flat vs. fair value. So were S&P 500 futures. Nasdaq 100 futures climbed a fraction.President Donald Trump reportedly has approved tariffs on $50 billion worth of Chinese goods, with a revised list affected products. The official announcement will come Friday, though it's not clear when the tariffs will go into effect. China has vowed to retaliate with its own tariffs, matching the U.S. dollar for dollar.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseAdobe Systems earnings rose 63% vs. a year earlier to $1.66 a share, beating second-quarter views for $1.54. Revenue climbed 24% to $2.20 billion, modestly topping. The IBD 50 stock also guided higher for the current Q3.Despite the seemingly positive news, Adobe stock fell 3.4% in late trade. That action offers three lessons for investors.Don't buy an extended stock: Adobe has run up 38.5% since its January breakout. The relative strength line, which tracks a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500 index, has consistently hit new highs. While Adobe could keep running, it would not be surprising to see Adobe pull back for a short period or consolidate over a period of weeks or months.Be cautious about buying a stock into earnings: Earnings reports are high risk, high reward. A strong report can send a stock soaring, but huge losses are also possible. Adobe's after-hours action is relatively muted give the stock's recent run. But investors should consider buying call options to minimize the downside risk while reaping any upside gains.Don't trust after-hours action: Whether it's Adobe stock or Dow Jones futures, overnight action doesn't always translate into trading in the next regular session. Perhaps Adobe will pull back modestly on Friday. But the stock could show a sharper loss or close with a gain.The Justice Department won't seek a stay to Tuesday night's federal court ruling. That would let the AT&T-Time Warner merger close, though the DOJ later could appeal the ruling itself. Time Warner stock rose 2% after hours. AT&T stock edged higher.During the regular session, Baidu (BIDU) spinoff iQiyi ran up nearly 17%, YY (YY) spinoff Huya jumped 13%, and Bilibili climbed 2.1%. In late trading all three rose about 1% to 2% in late trade.All three top China stocks hit record highs Thursday and are trading above their 10-day moving average. A near-term pullback wouldn't be surprising after their rapid run-ups.YOU MIGHT ALSO LIKE:The Big Picture: Nasdaq Shows Confident Action; Here Comes TrumpIBD Stock Of The Day: This IPO Skyrockets Through Buy PointTrump-China Trade War, Bank Of Japan, Canada Goose: Action PlanIBD Stock Of The Day: Hot New China IPO Flashes Key Technical SignThese 4 Stocks With 99 Composite Ratings Are In Buy RangeThese Top Stocks Expect 50% To 600% Earnings Growth In Q2

China growth stocks withered and Wall Street felt more selling pressure Wednesday as concerns over potential tariffs imposed on goods between the U.S. and its trading partners weighed on stocks today. The Nasdaq composite led with 1.5% decline, while the S&P 500 dropped almost 0.9%.Volume rose on both exchanges, according to early data. That signaled strong propensity among mutual funds, hedge funds, banks, insurers and the like to anxiously sell equities and raise cash.Meanwhile, Apple (AAPL) almost resisted the overall decline, edging less than 0.2% lower and outperforming the market. The relative strength has come at an important time. Earlier this week, the iPhone and iPad giant sold off hard and closed beneath its 50-day moving average for the first time in nearly two months.At 184.16, the megacap tech remains mildly above a 179.04 entry in a narrow and shallow double-bottom base. Therefore, for now, this is one reason why the leading tech stock can still be held by those who bought at the most recent proper buy point.The Dow Jones industrial average performed relatively better, losing just 0.7%, while the small-cap S&P 600 slid 1.4%. Yet at 1018, the S&P 600's 8.9% advance since Jan. 1 still sharply outperforms a less than 1% gain for the S&P 500.Breadth was severely negative as losing stocks outmatched winners on the Nasdaq by a 4-1 ratio. On the NYSE, losers beat winners by a 5-2 margin.Meanwhile, crude oil jumped sharply. U.S. near-term futures gaining 2.6% to $72.38 a barrel. The yield on the benchmark U.S. Treasury yield dropped 6 basis points to 2.82%.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseChinese ADRs performed miserably in the wake of a big sell-off in China mainland equities.Overnight, the Hang Seng benchmark in Hong Kong dropped more than 1.6% and reached its lowest level since early December. At 28,356, the Hang Seng is now down 5.2% year to date.Sector Leader play Baozun (BZUN) slumped more than 7% and sliced through its 50-day moving average in heavy turnover. The stock gave back all of a solid double-digit gain after breaking out of a seven-week base at 52.43.Baidu (BIDU) slumped for a fifth day in six sessions, falling more than 3% to 243.10 and closing back below the long-term 200-day moving average.Since the start of the year, the Chinese search engine has traced a series of higher highs and higher lows, but the severe choppiness has made it difficult for investors who have tried to buy Baidu shares on a breakout.Baidu announced plans to buy back as much as $1 billion worth of its common shares. The company's market value is nearly $85 billion.Plenty of other Chinese growth stocks got hammered.Autohome (ATHM), a former Leaderboard name, sharply undercut its 50-day moving average and issued a key defensive sell signal. Shares fell nearly 8% to 97.51 in volume that grew 169% above average.The 50-day moving average, painted as a red line in IBD's daily charts, had contained no fewer than five pullbacks by Autohome since early February.Therefore, Wednesday's big cut of the 50-day line showed a bearish change in character in the leading stock.The online marketing firm for the Chinese vehicle market had vaulted out of a double-bottom base at 66.55 on Jan. 2. It ultimately rallied 79% before sliding into its current price correction.Apple has not made much price progress compared with 2017, when it cleared a cup with handle at 118.12 on Jan. 6 of that year. That cup with handle was not only first stage, but also served as a bottoming-base chart pattern after the stock's lengthy decline. Shares have risen 64% since then.However, the stock has continued to trace a slow yet steady uptrend while finding buying support at the key 10- and 40-week moving averages.Plus, the fundamental picture still looks bright. Earnings in the June-ending fiscal third quarter are forecast to grow 31% to $2.18 a share. That would mark acceleration from EPS gains of 2%, 11%, 18%, 24%, 16% and 30% in the prior six quarters.On Wednesday, Reuters reported that Apple and arch rival Samsung of South Korea settled a years-long technology patent infringement suit in a U.S. district court in Northern California. Terms were not disclosed in the court filing.Also, earlier this week, the Economic Times of India reported that Apple plans to boost production of certain iPhone models in the South Asian country in a bid to lower costs.According to IBD Stock Checkup, Apple's SMR Rating has risen to a top-drawer A grade on a scale of A to E. This proprietary rating focuses on sales growth, profit margins, and return on equity.A handful of companies staged breakouts, but their finishes lacked oomph.Kemet (KEM), part of the IBD 50, attempted a breakout from a long, deep cup with handle that showed a 25.79 buy point. Shares got as high as a 3.7% gain to 26.33 before cooling off and falling 15 cents to 25.23. Volume jumped 54% above usual levels.The drop within Kemet's cup base, a 49.8% slide from a 27.35 high to 13.73 at the bottom, is way more than the acceptable limit of 33% to 35% corrections in a normal cup with handle.However, keep in mind that the stock ramped up from as low as 1.26 in early 2016, a 2,070% gain until it carved the latest base. In some cases, a leading stock can build such a deep base, break out properly, and keep running to new highs.Outstanding fundamentals going forward usually factor into the story.Kemet, an expert in capacitors for electronics manufacturers, has grown its earnings per share 44%, 175%, 250%, 450%, 246%, 373% and 221% vs. year-ago levels in the past seven quarters.That kind of blistering growth is not likely to continue. But the Street sees earnings in the fiscal first-quarter ending in June rising a healthy 39% to 46 cents a share.Despite Wednesday's negative reversal, Kemet hasn't yet triggered the golden rule of investing.(Please follow Saito-Chung on Twitter at @IBD_DChung for more commentary on growth stocks, buy points, breakouts, sell signals, and financial markets.)RELATED:This Key Tech Sector Flashes Big WarningThe Stock Market Gets A Bloody Nose; Watch For This Key Sell SignalThe Latest Inside Investor's CornerSector LeadersCan You Spot The Next Major Market Top? Baozun, a May 2015 new issue, has waged a terrific run-up ever since it cleared a super-deep bottoming base at 9.99 during the week ended Aug. 26, 2016. How long can its rally last?And more importantly, how much impact could the China-U.S. trade dispute have on the company's fundamentals?To answer the first question, it's really key to learn how to count bases.After a stock breaks out of a sound chart pattern, watch to see if rises 20% or more. If it does, the next serious decline begins the process of a new base.What if a stock rises just 15% from the proper buy point, then settles into a new base? Put another way: You find a stock that launches out of a cup with handle, breaks out, goes up 15%, but then forms a flat base on top of that cup? In most cases, both bases count as one entire base. IBD calls it simply a base on base.Going back to Baozun (BZUN), the stock nearly doubled in price and hit all-time highs after that first breakout in 2016. Base No. 2 was also quite deep, but Baozun cleared a 17.68 entry during the week ended May 5, 2017. That breakout spawned a 130% advance.Baozun formed two more bases, one from September 2017 and another from March 2018. These two bases showed big weekly price swings. But the breakout from these bases showed hefty volume, a good sign.Some late-stage breakouts can work, even if there's higher risk of failure, when a company has truly excellent fundamentals and solid institutional sponsorship.This week, the stock has fallen to the 10-week moving average for the first time since its May 17 breakout. A first or second rebound off the 10-week line offers investors a fresh opportunity to buy shares. Risk is higher now with the market's outlook downgraded by IBD on Monday to "uptrend under pressure."During a rally off the 10-week line, look for a swell in turnover. A strong price gain in heavy volume signals solid institutional demand. Try to buy as close as possible to the 10-week line, or in this case, near 55.70.Contrast Baozun's action to fellow Sector Leader ServiceNow (NOW). The latter dropped briefly below its 50-day moving average on Friday, then closed beneath the line on Monday. Volume hasn't been overly intense, however. On Monday, ServiceNow saw trading volume increase merely 3% above average.To answer the second question, on the U.S.-China trade dispute, it's key to study recent numbers.Baozun, the expert in e-commerce markets in the second largest economy, has superior earnings gains. According to IBD Leaderboard, the average EPS increase over the past three quarters is 58%. The Street sees earnings rising 27% in the second quarter.In Q1, the Shanghai-based firm reported a profit 0f 9 cents per share, a penny above the consensus forecast. Revenue has jumped 24%, 19%, 31% and 25% vs. year-ago levels in the past four quarters.According to a May 17 news release, Baozun said the number of its brand partners rose to 156 as of March 31 from 125 the same time a year earlier. Officials do not make clear how many of those partners are American corporations. One can surmise that many of its brand partners are East Asian companies. For instance, Baozun established a wholly owned subsidiary in October 2014 to expand its e-commerce services to the Taiwan market.In October 2015, Baozun started a 100%-owned unit aiming to introduce more Japanese brands to Chinese consumers. And in September 2016, it launched a joint venture with a division of the South Korean culture and lifestyle conglomerate CJ Group "to introduce highly sought-after Korean brands to Chinese consumers," according to a filing with the SEC.Get instant access to more trading ideas, exclusive stock lists and IBD proprietary ratings for only $5.RELATED:The Bull Market Gets A Bloody Nose; Watch For This Critical Sell Signal5 Reasons Why This Market Uptrend Is Still StrongThe Latest Inside Investor's Corner: This Should Happen On Breakout DayHow Many Chinese Companies Make The IBD 50 Today?

Others included China-based Baozun (BZUN), Grubhub (GRUB), and software names Tableau Software (DATA), HubSpot (HUBS) and New Relic (NEWR).YOU MIGHT ALSO LIKE:This Steel Firm Could Deliver Another Quarter Of Explosive GrowthBoeing Hits Sell Signal As China Trade War Helps Rival AirbusMarijuana Stocks: Here's The Latest Beer Giant To Consider Cannabis DrinksThe Latest Inside Investor's Corner

Privacy Policy & Terms of UseOil prices advanced more than 1%, pressured higher by a pullback in the dollar. Auto industry stocks have felt some pressure over the past couple of weeks as auto imports and exports have become a bargaining chip in the U.S. trade brawl with China.Ford (F) and General Motors (GM) rose less than 0.5% in early trade. Ford reported car sales down 14% in June, while sales of trucks rose 3.2% to 100,683 units. Fiat Chrysler (FCAU) jumped 1%, while Tesla (TSLA), Toyota Motor (TM) and Honda Motor (HMC) all traded down less than 1%.On the IBD 50 list, auto auction leader Copart pared its gain to less than 1% after jumping almost 2% at the open. The Dallas-based outfit's first day as an S&P 500 stock, replacing Dr. Pepper Snapple Group (DPS). Copart shares are up 32% so far this year. They have rebounded multiple times from their 10-week moving average, but have not paused to form a base since September.NetEase gained 1.3% after an upgrade to overweight, from underweight, from JPMorgan. Management projected industry demand would improve in the second half of the year, after several weak quarters. The Shanghai Composite dived 1.9% in early trade, as China's yuan tumbled below 6.7 vs. the dollar. Bloomberg cited unnamed sources saying that four major Chinese banks began selling dollars at the point, lifting the yuan back above the 6.7 mark.Shanghai stocks responded, with the composite climbing to close up 0.4%. Two central bank officials said China was closely watching the yuan. That and the dollar-buying action generated some optimism that the central bank was prepared to, if had not already, stepped in to support the currency. The yuan has fallen 3.7% vs. the dollar since mid-June.That is important, because the strength of China's currency and stock markets determine a large portion of the country's negotiating strength in its trade war vs. the U.S. Trade war tariffs go into effect on $34 billion in China-made imports to the U.S. on Friday. The leader with the strongest stock and financial markets is likely to enjoy broader support in standing firm on trade policy strategy.Europe's markets held their early gains with Germany leading after Chancellor Angela Merkel forged an immigration agreement and headed off a collapse of the country's governing coalition. Frankfurt's DAX was up 1.1% in afternoon trade. How much of a drop below the 10-week moving average should you tolerate before you sell a stock?58.com (WUBA) was a stock that was held on Leaderboard while it made a few pullbacks to or even below the 10-week line. It wasn't booted until it made a distinct break of that line, which teaches investors the importance of judging action at the 10-week line properly.The Chinese internet company, sometimes called the Craigslist of China, was added to Leaderboard on July 10 (1). At the time, the stock was breaking out of a cup without handle in double its usual volume. The base was well-crafted, with no wild price swings and a symmetrical outline.The stock closed slightly below the 47.48 buy point on the day of the breakout, but the next day it finished business above it. From that point on, shares never looked back. 58.com kept adding gains apace.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseOn Aug. 21, the company reported quarterly earnings. With some cushion from the entry, we decided to keep the stock through the report. The cushion would help absorb losses if results sparked a sell-off. Instead, shares soared more than 20% on the earnings announcement, widening the profit from the buy point.Some of the gains were wiped out in a Sept. 25 sell-off (2). But 58.com held at the 10-week and 50-day moving averages. That was a signal to continue holding. In fact, the show of support became a follow-on buy area for investors to add some shares and enhance their returns. Indeed, the stock quickly bounced back.By late October it was back to the 10-week line. This time, 58.com traded below the line, something that had not occurred in the entire run (3). Still, it was a modest drop below the moving average, and on Halloween the stock was right back above the line.In early December, a similar harmless pullback occurred (4). Yet there was something different this time. 58.com took longer to rebound, and a five-week cuplike pattern was actually an improper base. The stock managed to make some gains, but the peak was coming into focus.On Feb. 2, the stock closed the week down 15% and below the 10-week moving average (5). Notably, volume was 52% above average for the week. When a stock closes the week below the 10-week line in weekly volume at least 40% above average, that's a sell signal — one that had not appeared in earlier pullbacks.Conscious that 58.com was well past a standard 25% gain from the buy point, Leaderboard editors decided to remove the stock from the Leaders list. The profit from the breakout was more than 55%.Since then, 58.com has stalled. The stock broke out of another base on April 30, and was added back to the Leaders list at that time. But it was removed about three weeks later due to slack price action.With Leaderboard, investors can get the needed guidance, as market specialists study the selected stocks and annotate charts with the latest signals. Free trials are available.RELATED:Paycom Software Earnings Top Views, Guidance In Line, Shares FallNew Alerts For Leaderboard Help Investors Fine-Tune Holdings

Hot new IPO iQiyi (IQ), the Netflix (NFLX) of China, is the IBD Stock of the Day. The stock has had a huge run in a short span, is flashing some stalling action Tuesday. YY (YY) spinoff Huya (HUYA) and Bilibili (BILI), two other recent Chinese livestreaming IPOs, also have had big runs. Meanwhile, Momo (MOMO), a China streaming stock veteran, has also been rallying in recent weeks.The streaming service, still majority owned by Baidu (BIDU), is riding the wave of popularity for online movies and live media in China. U.S. investors have showered love on this wave of new and recent streaming companies, with iQiyi stock doubling in value in under three months.IQiyi made its IPO on March 29 at 18 and bolted to a new high of 35.95 in today's stock market action. But shares have pulled back to 1-cent gain at 34.52. Rapid trading with no price advance indicates a stalling day. Along with iQiyi stock's huge advance and being well-extended from the 10-day moving average, that action suggests a short-term pullback is likely.That could give investors a reason to book some profits.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseWhile iQiyi is growing fast, it's losing money. Its IPO filing showed 50.8 million subscribers — and losses of $574.4 million in 2017 on $2.67 billion in revenue.Per-share losses will continue for the foreseeable future, analysts say, narrowing from $7.80 this year and $6.48 in 2019, per Zacks Investment Research.The stock's fundamentals bear watching. Its IBD Composite Rating is a solid 90. But it has a lowly EPS Rating of 39 out of a best-possible 99.IQiyi also faces tough competition in China, primarily from Tencent (TCEHY) Video and the Alibaba (BABA)-owned Youku Tudou, reports say. But in a testament to its growth potential, Netflix struck a licensing deal last year, making some Netflix original shows available on the streaming service.Netflix also will reportedly acquire Chinese-language content from iQiyi and Youku Tudou.Huya, which is a video game livestreaming giant, has tripled since its May IPO at 12. Huya stock also is extended from its 10-day line. Huya fell 0.5% to 36.22 after setting a record 37.61 intraday.Bilibili, a youth-oriented online media platform, has also run in short order after its recent debut at 11.50. The stock hasn't run up quite as fast as iQiyi and Huya and is closer to its fast-rising 10-day line. Bilibili stock climbed 1.3% to 18.66.Momo blasted out of a long consolidation in late May and has continued to rally. Momo stock advanced 0.2% to 52.98.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:IBD Stock Of The Day: Epam Hits Buy Zone As New Base FormsIBD Stock Of The Day: Bank To The Tech Stars Sets Up Swing Trade, Add-On ChancesIBD Stock Of The Day: Chinese Internet Giant Powers Into Buy ZoneIBD Stock Of The Day: As Grubhub Hovers Near Buy Zone, Look For This Tasty SignalHow To Make Money In Stocks Using The CAN SLIM Investing System

If you follow the Investor's Business Daily analysis of the stock market closely, you know that a significant shift took place this past Monday.The Nasdaq composite got hammered by sellers on June 25, falling 2.1% in heavy turnover. That sell-off, combined with a dearth of impressive breakouts lately and a large load of distribution days (or significant declines in higher turnover), sent IBD's Market Pulse outlook in The Big Picture column one notch down to "uptrend under pressure."The outlook change doesn't mean you must sell the top dogs in your portfolio. View the new status as a yellow light on a traffic signal. Don't come to a full stop. Proceed with caution. But as the IBD 50 shows, if you hold many superior growth stocks, then you likely felt the heat of institutional selling a lot more than your neighbor who exclusively trades index ETFs.Major indexes showed nice rebounds on Thursday and through Friday afternoon trade. The S&P 500 cut its weekly loss to less than 0.6%. But companies in the IBD 50 shaved off a lot more of their recent gains. Twenty names, or 40% of the entire list, slumped more than 3% for the week through Thursday's close. Only Supernus Pharmaceuticals (SUPN), ZTO Express (ZTO) and Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND) and two more gained 2% or more.If you bought a true leader early in its run and your paper profit has topped 50%, 100%, or more, then you have the luxury of choices. If the stock is correcting in normal fashion, you might keep the entire position and wait for it to break out again. Or you might sell some shares, and give the rest a chance to grow more. A third option? Sell the entire position. Sit on the cash until you find a new royal opportunity.But what if your post-breakout gain runs in the 10% to 25% range? If you didn't take at least partial profits on the way up, then consider deciding where to draw the line in the sand.One of the most relevant sell rules: Don't let a double-digit gain turn into a loss. To go from, say, a 28% gain to an 8% loss not only hurts your portfolio; it can damage your personal investing psychology. If you come away with a single- or small double-digit gain, you can always buy back shares when the market shows better action.Momo (MOMO) illustrates how the 10-day moving average could help investors keep most of the advance after a May 18 breakout.At first, the move above a 40.55 buy point in an eight-week cup base was dull. But six sessions later, the Chinese social media play roared like a lion. It gapped up 15% in heavy volume on superb Q1 results (EPS up 57% to 69 cents, revenue up 64% to $435.1 million). Nine trading days later, the gain from 40.55 to a new high of 54.24 gushed up to 33%. A great profit.Besides selling on the way up once the stock hits the 20%-25% profit zone? Look for a sharp undercut of the short-term 10-day moving average. Momo did just that on June 19, falling 3.8% to 51.09. The 10-day line stood at a lofty 52.09, well above the 50-day moving average's value of 41.18. Sell at the June 19 close, and you would have locked in a 26% profit. (The 10-day line is not plotted on IBD Charts but is available in MarketSmith.)Momo's cup was lodged inside a larger, much deeper base. The stock has a penchant for making really big moves, really fast. So the recent waterfall slide to 41.44, just 2% above the 40.55 breakout point, should not come as a big surprise.All daily charts in IBD Leaderboard show the 10-day moving average as a green line.You can trade the IBD 50 in just one transaction with the Innovator IBD 50 (FFTY) exchange-traded fund, managed by Innovator Capital. The final week of the second quarter set out on a weak note Monday, as US. stocks opened down hard after trade fears had dragged markets in China and Europe lower.XChip stocks and China-based names took the early brunt of the latest exchange in the U.S.-China trade war. Intel (INTC) lagged lower, followed by Micron Technology (MU) and ASML Holdings (ASML). Among China-based stocks, smaller names felt the hardest early hits, but Alibaba Group (BABA), Baidu (BIDU) and JD.com (JD) also gave up ground in early trade.The Nasdaq Composite skidded 0.8% lower as Intel, Ctrip.com International (CTRP) and Micron Semiconductor suffered the index's deepest early declines.The Dow industrials carved a 0.7% loss. The S&P 500 traded down 0.5%. Carnival (CCL), Intel and Kroger (KR) posted the three deepest losses among S&P 500 stocks.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseChina's markets and currency tumbled lower Monday as the Trump administration broadened its definition of what it considers a threat to the U.S. economy. The Treasury Department is reportedly at work on trade rules that would block China-owned firms from investing in "industrially significant technology" in the U.S. Also, the National Security Council and the Commerce Department are ratcheting up restrictions on export of such technologies to China. Increased U.S. trade tariffs against goods imported from China are due to take effect July 5.Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index dumped its early gain and dived 1.3%. The Shanghai Composite crumbled 1.1%. In Japan, Tokyo's Nikkei 225 slumped 0.8%.The selling washed into Europe, where markets opened sharply lower. Frankfurt's DAX and London's FTSE 100 each drilled down 1.6% in afternoon trade 1.2%. The CAC-40 in Paris 1% lower.The Dow industrials closed Friday just 0.3% below its 50-day moving average. That gap widened at Monday open, but trade was far from grim. Intel was the only Dow issue down more than 2%. And only two Dow issues, Boeing (BA) — a name clearly within the definition of the White House's "industrially significant technologies" category — fell nearly 3%. That was enough to send the stock more than 8% below a 331.10 buy point, triggering the automatic sell rule.Intel tumbled 2.3%, still reeling from Thursday's news that Chief Executive Brian Krzanich would resign after having a relationship with an employee. Chief Financial Officer Bob Swan is now serving as interim CEO. Intel shares dropped 4.8% last week. A report Sunday from the Wall Street Journal said competitors had begun eating into Intel's market share, as manufacturing issues under the Krzanich regime delayed delivery of high-end chips. On Monday, Nomura downgraded Intel to neutral, from buy, and trimmed its price target to 55, from 60.Harley Davidson shares fell 2.9% after a regulatory filing said the company would shift production for motorcycles sold in the European Union out of the U.S. in order to avoid trade tariffs. Tariffs of 31% imposed by the EU would raised costs for U.S.-made Harley's by ardoun $2,200 each, the company said. Harley sees 15% of its sales from the EU. The company has previously navigated around tariffs in other countries by setting up manufacturing operations places including Thailand. Harley said it would make the move in the next 18 months. Harley shares have been in a deepening correction for 15 months.The FANG stock tech leaders fell hard in early trade. Netflix (NFLX) led, down more than 4%. That left the IBD Leaderboard name is 14% above a 338.92 buy point in a flat base. The stock had climbed more than 20% above the buy point last week, placing it in a profit-taking zone.Alphabet dumped 2.2%, sending it back below a handle buy point at 1,161.20 in a double-bottom base.Gray Television spiked more than 17% in premarket trade. The television-station owner announced it would pay $3.6 billion in cash and stock to acquire Raycom. Montgomery, Ala.-based Raycom owns 65 television stations in 20 states. The combined company would own 142 full-power stations in 92 markets, giving it the third-largest portfolio in the U.S., the company said in a release. Gray shares have been consolidation since February, ending Friday 39% below their February high.China-based stocks were bludgeoned in premarket action. Huya (HUYA), 58.com (WUBA) and iQiyi (IQ) all fell more than 4%.Among chip-related names, Netherlands-based ASML Holdings sliced 2.6% lower and Micron Technology shed 2.4%, leading the losses on the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index.On the IBD 50 list, China names YY (YY) and ZTO Express (ZTO) each shed more than 2%. YY has been maintaining support as it builds the right side of a six-month base. ZTO dived 8.4% last week, leaving it still extended above an 18.18 buy point in a cup base.In economic news, the Chicago Federal Reserve Bank's National Activity Index turned negative, reading a minus 0.15 for May that was sharply below April's positive 0.42 tally. The index's three-month moving average fell to a positive 0.18, down from 0.48 in April.May new homes sales data from the Commerce Department are due out at 10 a.m. ET.Oil prices were mixed, with U.S.-benchmarked West Texas Intermediate up 0.8% and Europe's Brent crude benchmark down 1.6% in morning trade. Brent was below $75 per barrel. WTI held just above $69. WTI had surged more than 4% on Friday, after OPEC and partners including Russia agreed to a nominal 600,000-barrel increase to its production quota.The second-quarter reporting season doesn't start for another two weeks, but late-season reports continue to roll in from the March quarter. Cruise line Carnival tanked nearly 9% after reporting a stronger-than-expected second-quarter performance. But the company's third-quarter and full-year earnings guidance were below expectations.Lennar (LEN) and Schnitzer Steel (SCHN) report on Tuesday. General Mills (GIS) and Rite-Aid (RAD) are due on Wednesday, with Nike (NKE), Walgreen Boots Alliance (WBA) and KBHome (KBH) due later in the week.YOU MIGHT ALSO LIKE:Dow Jones Futures Fall As U.S. Plans China Tech Curbs: These 5 Top Stocks Are Near Buy PointsNike, Marijuana Earnings; Bank Payouts: Investing Action Plan If You Want To Buy More Apple Or Nvidia Shares, Read ThisGet A Handle On These 4 Notable Stocks Near Buy PointsThe Big Picture: Is The Selling In Leading Growth Stocks An Ominous Sign?Three Hot IPOs Flash Sell Signals; China Plays Keep Tumbling
