Will the current creep up in interest rates slow demand in the vacation-resort time share market? One executive answers an emphatic, "No."Mike Flaskey, CEO of Diamond Resorts, says his firm is "very bullish" and aims to keep expanding in hot leisure destinations such as Hawaii. One piece of proof: the company's recent $225 million purchase of The Modern Honolulu in Oahu.Diamond will upgrade it to meet customers' demands for luxury-style suite accommodations that feature full-size kitchens and one- or two-bedroom formats."It's a four-star property. We're going to go through it floor by floor," Flaskey told IBD during an interview Monday at the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, Calif.Flaskey said that Diamond Resorts generates roughly $100 million in annual sales centered on its collection of membership-based hotels across the entire Hawaiian isles. While Las Vegas is Diamond's top sales market, Flaskey believes Hawaii will in time take the top spot.One leg of Diamond's business is financing the purchase of customers' points-based time share ownership. Flaskey says the typical customer makes a 15% down payment on an average transaction of $24,000. Then he or she borrows to pay off the rest via a loan from Diamond."Middle America is our customer. The usual household income is between $110,000 and $140,000," Flaskey said. "They are very comfortable with making a regular payment" to fund the buy. Plus, 30% of Diamond's customers pay off the outstanding loan before maturity.Flaskey's bullish sentiment dovetails with the rising fortunes in recent years among publicly traded hotel companies.The lodging industry veteran foresees the total public market value of timeshare-oriented companies rising to nearly $37 billion within a couple of years. That's up nearly fourfold since the fall of 2013, when Diamond Resorts and competitor Marriott Vacations Worldwide (VAC) totaled less than $10 billion in market cap.Marriott Vacations fell more than 8% in big volume Monday. Plus, shares undercut the 200-day moving average on news it's buying Miami-based ILG (ILG). The operator of the Interval International "exchange network" allows timeshare owners the opportunity to access other properties.IBD's Leisure-Lodging group has faded within rankings of 197 industries for six-month price performance. Through Monday, the 15-member group ranked 79th, down from 64th six weeks ago. But seven companies, nearly half of the total, carry a Relative Price Strength Rating of 80 or higher. They include Hyatt (H), Hilton Worldwide (HLT) and Marriott (MAR). All three stocks are forming new bases after decent run-ups since the fourth quarter of last year.In the same group, China Lodging (HTHT) shows the best ratings from IBD Stock Checkup, including a best possible 99 Composite Rating on a scale of 1 to 99. The diversified hotel chain broke the $1 billion sales barrier in 2017, growing the top line by 25% to $1.22 billion. China Lodging earned a record $2.66 a share, up 46%.The best stocks in the market tend to break out of well-formed bases, such as the cup with handle, while having strong RS ratings. In the same lodging group, Hilton Grand Vacations (HGV) shows a 79 RS score and an 85 Composite on IBD Stock Checkup. The stock has risen as much as 75% since its debut in January 2017.Diamond Resorts had traded on the NYSE from its July 2013 debut until September 2016, when private equity giant Apollo Global Management completed its $2.2 billion acquisition.The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury bond hit 3% last week for the first time since January 2014. The yield has more than doubled from a July 2016 low near 1.37%.The Federal Reserve is not expected to hike the cost of money at the end of two-day meeting Wednesday. Futures traders, though, are seeing a nearly 50-50 chance that the fed funds rate will reach a 2.25%-2.5% target level by December. That implies three more rate hikes of a quarter point each for the rest of the year.The current fed funds target is 1.5%-1.75%.RELATED:Where Is The Stock Market Headed Right Now? Sprint (S) and T-Mobile US (TMUS) sold off on Monday as investors focused on chances that their proposed merger will be approved by federal regulators."The market seems to be ascribing very low odds to approval," New Street Research analyst Jonathan Chaplin said in a report to clients.Sprint and T-Mobile announced their merger deal on Sunday. The new company would be called T-Mobile..T-Mobile plunged 6.26% to 60.51 on the stock market today while Sprint tumbled 13.7% to close at 5.61. Sprint shareholders also digested a disappointing valuation of Sprint in the deal hammered out by parents SoftBank (SFTBY) and Deutsche Telekom (DTEGY). While Deutsche Telekom struck a favorable deal with Japan's SoftBank, shares in the German phone company fell a fraction on Monday in trading in Europe.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of Use"Regulatory approval is a tossup in our view," UBS analyst John Hodulik said in his note to clients.If the deal is blocked by regulators, Sprint has the most to lose, analysts say. That's because debt-laden Sprint's competitive position is much weaker than T-Mobile, which has been gaining share vs. Verizon Communications (VZ) and AT&T (T). Plus, a breakup fee is not included in the merger agreement.One question is whether federal regulators will approve a merger that reduces the number of national wireless firms to three from four. The other two major players in the market are Verizon and AT&T.Further, foreign ownership could be a hot potato amid rising trade tensions between the Trump administration and Germany, says one analyst."One may ask how the current U.S. administration, which places much emphasis on 'putting America first,' will view the creation of a major foreign-controlled operator that aims to deliver significant synergies to its German and Japanese majority shareholders — no matter how these synergies are pitched," Jefferies analyst Ulrich Rathe said in his report.President Trump has threatened to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, a move opposed by German business and Chancellor Angela Merkel. The U.S. ran a nearly $65 billion trade deficit in goods with Germany last year. President Trump has been critical of Merkel's trade policies, saying German imports have damaged the U.S. manufacturing industry in such areas as car production.Before the merger announcement, Softbank Chief Executive Masayoshi Son had courted President Trump with pledges to invest in the U.S. and create jobs."While we believe the merger has an improved chance of regulatory approval given management's outlook for job creation, there are likely to remain concerns about customer concentration and the impact on overall consumer pricing given that T-Mobile and Sprint were market leaders in pricing," William Blair analyst Jim Breen said in his note.Sprint and T-Mobile promise to sustain competition by investing in next-generation 5G technology. In turn, the 5G investments would create jobs, they say.Deutsche Telekom plans to own a 42% stake in a combined Sprint-T-Mobile, with SoftBank taking a 27% share. Public shareholders get the rest of the company.The all-stock transaction has an exchange rate of one T-Mobile share per 9.75 Sprint shares. It reflects T-Mobile's market resurgence while debt-laden Sprint's turnaround remained in question.Deutsche Telekom says it would appoint 9 out of 14 board members and consolidate the merged company's financial results.Shares in AT&T slipped 1% to 32.70. AT&T sold off last week when it reported Q1 earnings that missed views. Verizon fell 4.3% to 49.35. Shares in cellphone tower operators Crown Castle (CCI) edged down while American Tower (AMT) edged up.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Charter, Comcast, Altice Dive As Cable TV Subscriber Losses MountAT&T Plunges On Its Own Weak Results, And Those Of Time WarnerTelecom Stocks To Watch And Industry NewsSell And Take Profits Or Hold? Facebook (FB) plans to reorganize into three divisions and form a new group focused on blockchain technology, reports said Tuesday.XThe company will appoint new leaders for its Messenger and WhatsApp messaging platform while giving other longtime executives new responsibilities, according to a report from Recode. That includes dedicating a new team to blockchain.The new blockchain group will be headed by David Marcus, who headed the Messenger group. Marcus is also a director at Coinbase, a cryptocurrency exchange. Blockchain serves as the technical foundation for all cryptocurrencies.Employees got word of the moves Tuesday, as Facebook faced an intense backlash over the Cambridge Analytica data privacy scandal.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseFacebook shares were unchanged after hours at 178.92.Replacing Marcus at Messenger will be the unit's vice president of product, Stan Chudnovsky, according to a tweet by Marcus.Recode also said Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has reorganized the company's product and engineering groups into three main divisions. This includes a new "family of apps" group run by Chris Cox, chief product officer.Cox will oversee Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Messenger, Recode reported, citing multiple sources. The other group is referred to as "New platforms and infra," which will be managed by Chief Technology Officer Mike Schroepfer. Schroepfer also will oversee the company's virtual reality and augmented reality unit.It also said longtime Facebook executive Javier Olivan, the company's vice president of growth, will oversee the third division, called "Central product services." That includes all of the shared features that operate across multiple products or apps such as ads, security and growth.The company also said Jeff Zients, chief executive of Cranemere, has been appointed to the company's board of directors and audit committee.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Facebook's Zuckerberg Admits Big Mistake, Apologizes For ScandalSnap Dives To Record Low As First-Quarter Earnings Disappoint Investors

Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) rode the surge in oil prices to even greater heights, posting a profit not seen since the days of $100 a barrel. Investors were displeased that the company didn't take them along for the ride.XWhile French rival Total (TOT) has started disbursing the rewards of rising energy prices -- with higher dividends and share buybacks -- Shell has other priorities, at least for now. Chief Financial Officer Jessica Uhl declined to say when her planned $25 billion to $30 billion stock-repurchase program would start, telling reporters on a call that she wanted to focus on debt reduction first.There are two big reasons for the company's caution. First, it still has to pay off the acquisition of BG Group Plc in 2016, a deal that's turbo charged natural gas earnings but left Shell heavily indebted. Second, its cash flow -- little changed from a year earlier despite higher oil prices -- "may not necessarily support" the planned buybacks, according to RBC Capital Markets.Earnings at Europe's largest energy company vaulted ahead of the upswing in crude to an average of $67 in the first quarter, reaping the benefits of years of cost cuts. Adjusted net income was $5.32 billion last quarter, compared with $3.75 billion a year earlier. That surpassed analysts expectations of $5.2 billion, rising to a level only consistently seen when oil traded for more than $100.Get Free Access To IBD Digital Through April 29

Get premium stock lists, pass or fail stock ratings and more. Start HereTotal and Statoil (STO) also posted the best earnings in years this week, with Total pumping a record amount of oil and gas in the first quarter. Shares of the French company rose in response to its results, the opposite of the reaction to Shell.Shell dropped as much as 2.8% as analysts raised concerns about flat cash flow from operations, which was $9.43 billion in the first three months of 2018."The only negative here is the conversion of those earnings into cash flow," Oswald Clint, an analyst at Bernstein Research, said by telephone. "It's a little bit lighter than what I was expecting."Shell's free cash flow was sufficient to fund the company's cash dividends and interest payments in the first quarter, which wasn't always the case during the oil-price slump. Like its peers, Shell was forced to make some payments to investors in shares during the downturn, known as a scrip dividend, while also borrowing to fund the cash portion of the payout.Those newly created shares diluted the holdings of some investors, who have maintained a sharp focus on the timing of the buybacks required to offset the impact. Shell wasn't able to offer a clear answer on what could trigger the repurchases."It's an integrated decision. I've provided enough insight," CFO Uhl told reporters in response to several questions about buybacks.That situation should change. Barclays analysts said in a note that they expect Shell to begin the program in the second half."We would expect cash flow growth through the year supported by the current macro environment," said Biraj Borkhataria, an analyst at RBC Capital Markets. "Royal Dutch Shell remains one of our preferred super-majors."YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:ConocoPhillips Crushes Earnings Views Ahead Of Exxon, Chevron ResultsEnergy Stocks And Industry NewsBest Growth Stocks To Buy And Watch: See Updates To IBD Stock ListsStocks To Buy And Watch: Top IPOs, Big And Small Caps, Growth StocksLooking For The Best Stocks To Buy And Watch? T-Mobile US (TMUS)  and Sprint (S) agreed to combine in a $26.5 billion merger, creating a wireless giant to compete against industry leaders AT&T (T) and Verizon Communications (VZ), it was announced Sunday.German-based Deutsche Telekom (DTEGY), T-Mobile's parent, and SoftBank Group (SFTBY), Tokyo-based owner of Sprint, agreed to a deal after months of wrangling. It values each Sprint share at 0.10256 of a T-Mobile share, the companies said in a written statement. That ratio values Sprint at $6.62 a share based on T-Mobile's Friday closing price of $64.52.Sprint closed Friday at $6.50 a share, but fell to about 6 in late trading Friday on buzz that a deal was near.The new company will use the T-Mobile name. T-Mobile's John Legere will be chief executive and Mike Sievert becomes chief operating officer. The German company's chairman, Tom Hoettges, will serve in that role at the combined company.The board will include SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son. The companies said they expect synergies of about $43 billion, with more than $6.5 billion on a run-rate basis.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of Use"This combination will create a fierce competitor with the network scale to deliver more for consumers and businesses in the form of lower prices, more innovation, and a second-to-none network experience — and do it all so much faster than either company could on its own," Legere said in the statement.Deutsche Telekom will end up with a 42% ownership stake while SoftBank will have 27%.The combination of Sprint and T-Mobile would create a company with about $74 billion in annual revenue and 70 million wireless subscribers. Verizon is the largest U.S. carrier with $88 billion in 2017 wireless revenue and 111 million subscribers. AT&T would remain No. 2 with $71 billion in wireless revenue and 78 million regular subscribers.The latest negotiations, coming about five months after an earlier merger attempt collapsed, follow years of will-they-won't-they deliberations. Previous negotiations broke down after the two sides couldn't agree on how to structure control of the combined entity, sources said. The deal marks the third time Son has acted on his long-held plan to combine Sprint and T-Mobile.Deutsche Telekom and T-Mobile were advised by Goldman Sachs and PJT, with Evercore advising the independent directors. Raine and JPMorgan advised SoftBank and Sprint, with Centerview helping the special committee of directors.

Casino stocks Wynn Resorts (WYNN), Melco Resorts & Entertainment (MLCO) and Las Vegas Sands (LVS) climbed Tuesday as they got a boost from analyst-beating Macau gaming revenue last month.But MGM Resorts International (MGM), which is more Las Vegas-centric, suffered from weak April revenue and visitation in the U.S. gambling mecca.Results posted Tuesday showed sales in Macau, which is China's only legal casino hub, shoot up 27.6% to 25.73 billion patacas ($3.18 billion), crushing views of 18%-22% growth. The world's largest gambling area is the top revenue driver for Wynn Resorts, Melco Resorts & Entertainment and Las Vegas Sands.The former Portuguese colony's gaming results show continued momentum, however revenues have yet to return to the highs of 2014. They have now risen for the 21st month in a row since plunging during a crackdown on corruption in 2014.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe S&P 500 stock is one of the main winners from increasing Macau revenues, as it holds the Wynn Palace and Wynn Macau casino resorts in the region. It closed up 3% at 191.83 on the stock market today, though it was in average volume. Wynn Resorts stock formed an 11-week cup-with-handle base and is nearing a correct entry point of 192.85, MarketSmith analysis shows. It has made gains in the last three trading sessions.Wynn has slipped from its leading position to third in the Leisure-Gaming/Equipment Group and has an IBD Composite Rating of 94.Its Macau revenues helped the company romp home with a double beat when it announced Q1 earnings last month. It posted revenue of $1.72 billion, up 20.5%, while earnings per share came in at $2.30. During the fourth quarter, Wynn's earnings nearly tripled on gaming results from Macau.In the company's earnings release, the firm said it expected its long-awaited Wynn Boston Harbor property to open in the middle of next year.Wynn Resorts has cited its "dependence on Stephen A. Wynn" as a risk to its business. The company founder resigned from his position as CEO amid allegations of sexual misconduct in February.The stock, whose China properties include City of Dreams Macau, Studio City and Altira Macau, rose 3.3% to 32.25. The firm draws much of its sales from its Chinese locations, and is owned by Hong Kong-based Melco International Development.The stock remains in buy range after a nine-week consolidation, with a correct entry of 30.59. Its Composite Rating has increased to 86, however it still lags Wynn Resorts. But its Relative Strength Rating is a strong 92, while its RS line is at its highest level in more than three years.The Sands Macao and The Plaza Macao operator rallied 2.1% to 74.86. The stock has been building a flat base for the past 14 weeks, and despite the boost is still a long way from its buy point of 79.94. However, it is gaining strength, with its relative strength line at its highest level for around three years.The stock boasts an impressive IBD Composite Rating of 98, its upgrade last week moving it into joint first place with Churchill Downs (CHDN).The moved came after the company posted 58% earnings growth for Q1. That means it's now posted two straight quarters of rising EPS growth. Sales growth rose 17%, up from 12% in the prior quarter. That marks two quarters of increasing revenue gains.The good news from Macau was not enough to lift MGM, which dipped 0.1% to 31.40.Last week, the stock plummeted through both its 50- and 200-day lines after reporting that net revenue from its U.S. resorts, mainly located in Las Vegas, fell 1% in the same quarter last year. This was despite the firm beating on both revenue and earnings.Even without this, the stock looks dicey, with an IBD Composite Rating of just 35 and a dire RS rating of 27.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN: Wynn Resorts First-Quarter Earnings Top, Hikes Dividend Macau Gaming Revenue Soars Most Since 2014; Casino Stocks Rally, Even This OneNBA Backs Nationwide Sports Betting — For This Price Want To Gamble On Bitcoin? Roku (ROKU) provides a popular platform for viewing subscription video-on-demand services like Netflix (NFLX), but increasingly its users are watching free, advertiser-supported streaming channels, the company said late Wednesday.That trend helped the Los Gatos, Calif.-based company beat Wall Street's sales and earnings targets for the March quarter. It also guided higher for the current quarter and full year.But Roku shares dipped 1.7% to close at 35.46 on the stock market today. The company went public at 14 on Sept. 28. It reached an all-time high of 58.80 on Dec. 19.Roku ended the quarter with 20.8 million active accounts, up 1.5 million from the December quarter. Streaming hours on the platform increased 56% year over year to 5.1 billion hours, with the fastest growth coming from ad-supported content.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe company is focused on growth and with a goal this year of running the business at or near break-even.Roku lost an adjusted 7 cents a share in the first quarter as sales rose 36% year over year to $136.6 million. Analysts expected the company to lose 16 cents a share on sales of $128 million, according to Zacks Investment Research.Roku licenses a smart-TV operating system to consumer electronics firms. It also makes its own set-top boxes and TV dongles for accessing internet television services.The company faces competition from rival streaming devices from Amazon.com (AMZN), Apple (AAPL) and others, as well as TV manufacturers opting for alternative operating systems.Roku monetizes its platform and user base mostly through advertising sales. It also gets a share of sales from pay-per-view and subscription video-on-demand services.One in four smart TVs sold in the U.S. last quarter were Roku TVs. That's up from one in five in 2017. Half of Roku's new accounts in the first quarter came from licensed sources, primarily Roku TVs.Most of Roku's users are in the U.S., but the company operates in 23 countries internationally, Roku Chief Financial Officer Steve Louden told Investor's Business Daily."We feel like we're in the early days of streaming taking off in the U.S. and certainly internationally, so there's a big opportunity ahead," he said. More than 40% of the content on Roku has ads, Louden said.Roku launched its own advertiser-supported streaming channel, the Roku Channel, eight months ago. It is now one of the top 15 channels on Roku devices, based on hours streamed.The company is working to get the Roku Channel on non-Roku devices, starting with Samsung TVs this summer.Roku believes there's a big opportunity to sell advertising for over-the-top internet television as cord-cutting and the shift to streaming video continue."Today, roughly 10% of all adults between 18 and 34 can only be reached on TV on the Roku platform in the living room," Roku executives said in a letter to shareholders Wednesday. "We expect that number to grow, which should make our platform an even more important way for brands to engage TV viewers."William Blair analyst Ralph Schackart reiterated his outperform rating on Roku stock on Thursday."As the traditional-TV ad market transitions in favor of OTT (over-the-top) and streamed video, we believe Roku is well positioned to take advantage," he said in a report.KeyBanc Capital Markets analyst Evan Wingren maintained his overweight rating on Roku, but raised his price target to 44 from 42."The shift to streaming video, smart-TV share gains, and early results from the Roku Channel are translating into platform growth above expectations, and the outlook still sets up conservatively from here," Wingren said in a report. "Long term, we see proof points that Roku's competitive position in streaming is strengthening."RELATED:Roku Beats First-Quarter Views As Active Users Grow 47%

Japan's Takeda Pharmaceuticals clinched the $62 billion acquisition of Shire (SHPG) early Tuesday after a six-week tussle between the two companies in which Allergan (AGN) also was briefly interested in a possible merger.If approved, it will be the largest overseas purchase by a Japanese company, according to Dealogic. Dealogic says that with debt, the deal is worth $81.5 billion. Takeda will add its roughly $33 billion market cap to Shire's, which is north of $49 billion. The new Takeda will be close in size to Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY) and Eli Lilly (LLY).RBC analyst Douglas Miehm said the deal alleviates some concerns, notably that the Japanese drugmaker could de-lever sufficiently and that its dividend will remain intact. The firm expects to general annual pretax cost synergies of $1.4 billion by the end of the third year."We do anticipate the deal spread to remain wider than normal given the complexity of the transaction requiring approval in various geographies, ability to realize synergies, especially R&D (research and development) and long-dated closing date," he said in a note to clients.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe total deal is consistent with Takeda's fifth proposal and values Dublin-based Shire at 49.01 pounds, or about $66.21, per share. All together, Takeda will pay 46 billion pounds, or roughly $62.1 billion. The companies expect the deal to close in the first half of 2019.Under the terms of the deal, Shire shareholders will receive $30.33 in cash and either 0.839 new Takeda shares or 1.678 Takeda American depositary receipts for each Shire share. When the deal wraps, Shire shareholders will own 50% of the new Takeda.Takeda's new shares will also trade on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and the New York Stock Exchange.RBC's Miehm noted that the acquisition is expected to be significantly accretive to earnings from the first full fiscal year following the close. It's also expected to provide a return on interest above Takeda's cost of capital over the same time period.Takeda confirmed that it still needs approval from two-thirds of its existing shareholders. But it is confident it can get those votes, Miehm said. To pay for the acquisition, Takeda entered into a bridge credit agreement — a type of loan — for $30.85 billion.Miehm kept his outperform rating on Shire stock. On the stock market today, Shire rose 1.5% to close at 163.73. That, and first-quarter outperformance from Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX), didn't help drug stocks more broadly, though, which dipped 0.3%.RELATED:How Do You Spot A Major Market Top? Tesaro (TSRO) stock crumbled late Thursday after it reported wider-than-expected losses on first-quarter sales that also missed Wall Street's views.But 2018 revenue guidance was strong and topped the consensus by more than $21 million at the midpoint.In after-hours trading on the stock market today, Tesaro plunged 5.5%, near 45.70, after losing 5.1% at the closing bell, to 48.36. Biotech stocks ended the regular session down 1.8%.For the first quarter, Tesaro reported $49.7 million in sales, shooting up from $3.07 million in the year-ago period. But that missed the consensus of analysts polled by Zacks Investment Research for $57 million.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseDuring the quarter, Tesaro's PARP inhibitor Zejula brought in $48.9 million in sales. That grew from $2.1 million in the year-earlier period. Zejula rivals other PARP inhibitors from AstraZeneca (AZN) and Clovis Oncology (CLVS). These drugs treat ovarian cancer.A loss of $2.98 per share grew from a year-earlier loss of $2.55 per share. That was wider than the consensus projection for a per-share loss of $2.76.Still, guidance was strong. Tesaro expects total sales of $310 million to $345 million this year.The midpoint of $327.5 million easily beat analysts' consensus of $306 million. Of that, Tesaro expects $255 million to $275 million in sales of Zejula.RELATED:How Do You Spot A Major Market Top? Computer peripherals maker Logitech International (LOGI) saw its stock soar on Thursday after it posted better-than-expected March-quarter results and gave rosy guidance for the year ahead.Logitech shares jumped 8.9% to close at 39.99 on the stock market today. The stock broke out of a 26-week consolidation period with a buy point of 40.92 on Jan. 23 after it reported robust sales and earnings for the holiday quarter. But the stock sold off after the market turned choppy.The maker of music, gaming, video and computing products on Thursday reported adjusted earnings per share of 32 cents, up 7% year over year, for its fiscal fourth quarter. Sales climbed 16% to $592 million. Analysts expected Logitech to earn an adjusted 23 cents a share on sales of $556 million.For the current fiscal year, Logitech expects high single-digit sales growth, confirming its prior guidance.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseLogitech Chief Executive Bracken Darrell credited strong sales of video collaboration gear for business-to-business communication as well as gaming peripherals for its outsize performance last quarter."The fun categories to talk about are gaming and video collaboration," he told Investor's Business Daily. "It's such an exciting time in gaming."Video gaming peripherals such as audio headsets, PC keyboards and mice have gotten a boost from the rapid growth of esports, Darrell said.The rise of esports feels a lot like the early days of the NBA and NFL sports leagues, he said. Darrell noted professional video game leagues for "League of Legends" from Tencent (TCEHY) and "Overwatch" from Activision Blizzard (ATVI).Young people are playing these games and others in online competitions and want to emulate their favorite professional players by buying pro gear, he said.Logitech stock has a middling IBD Composite Rating of 66 out of a best-possible 99. It is the top-rated stock in the downtrodden computer hardware and peripherals industry group.RELATED:Spotify Stock Falls On Subscription Pricing Pressure

Oil prices spiked Monday after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu claimed that he has documents that show Iran cheated on the nuclear deal that allowed it to boost crude exports.XNetanyahu said he has a cache of tens of thousands of documents from a "highly secret location" in Iran that showed Tehran was working on nuclear weapons to get around investigators.He added that he met with new Secretary of State Mike Pompeo over the weekend and said he shared the cache with the U.S., and that the U.S. could "vouch for its authenticity."U.S. oil prices climbed 0.7% to $68.47 a barrel, paring gains after jumping 1.7% earlier. Brent oil prices rose 0.7% to $75.17 per barrel. Crude had earlier gotten a boost, after Israel was suspected of launching airstrikes in on Iran-linked targets in Syria over the weekend.EOG Resources (EOG), which reports earnings Thursday, was up 1.2% at 118.17 on the stock market today, nearing its 119.10 buy point in a first-stage cup base. Matador Resources (MTDR), which reports Wednesday, rallied 0.9% to 32.74, closing in on a 34.06 entry. BP (BP) rose 0.8% to 44.59, almost retaking a 44.72 buy point from a cup base initially cleared last week. Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) added 0.2% to 69.91, working on a 71.72 buy point in a cup-with-handle base. Occidental Petroleum (OXY) rose 0.3% to 77.26, nearing a 78.19 entry.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UsePresident Trump has until May 12 to decide if he will reinstate the sanctions that were lifted as part of the Iran nuclear deal.  Trump, along with Israel and Saudi Arabia, has been vocal critic of the multilateral agreement.But China, France, Germany, Russia and the U.K. have supported the deal, and the International Energy Agency has said Tehran has been complying to the deal. The leaders of France and Germany also personally urged Trump to stick with the deal in separate White House visits last week.Pompeo has also increased the likelihood of harsher sanctions against Iran, James Williams, an economist at energy consultant WTRG told IBD last month.Williams said sanctions with Iran would reduce Iranian oil production, noting that oil prices hit $100 a barrel when the Obama administration levied sanctions on Iran. While oil won't hit $100 this time, he said prices will still go higher.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN: Energy Stocks And Industry News: Oil, Gas, Solar, CoalEarnings Calendar, Analyst Estimates And Stocks To WatchStocks Near Buy Zone Ahead Of Earnings

Shares of Alibaba stock, one of the best Chinese stocks in recent years, have been suffering from a lack of buying demand. The weakness comes after a bullish follow-through day for the Nasdaq last week.A breakout during the week ended Jan. 26 was powerful as shares of Alibaba (BABA) surged 11.5% in strong volume. But new buyers were disappointed when shares lost nearly 9% the following week in higher volume. Volume during that down week surged 50% above the 10-week average as well.Big sellers in a stock immediately after a breakout is never a good sign. In Alibaba's case, it foreshadowed more price weakness.Alibaba's stock is currently testing support at the 200-day moving average, a longer-term support level. The test comes after Alibaba gapped below the 50-day line on March 22 in heavy volume.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseHow can a stock like Alibaba turn into a laggard amid seemingly bright fundamentals?Sales growth accelerated nicely in the latest reported quarter, up 66% from a year ago to $12.75 billion. In Q3 last year, the top line increased 47%. For the current quarter, sales are seen rising 52% to $9.28 billion. Annual earnings estimates are also robust, with EPS this year expected to rise 54% from 2017 to $5.27.The lack of buying interest is due, in part, to a slowdown in institutional demand. Alibaba's up-down volume ratio is a tepid 1.0, while its Accumulation/Distribution Rating has faltered to C- on a scale of A to E.Several recent higher-volume declines are the culprit. Alibaba stock is not under heavy distribution, but signs of institutional selling started in early February. Three above-average volume declines from Feb. 1-5 were a sign of it.New signs of institutional buying would strengthen Alibaba's technical picture. Watch for higher-volume gains from here. The stock's 50-day moving average is a potential resistance level to watch. But if mutual funds and other big investors start buying shares again, a move back above the 50-day line is possible.A double-bottom pattern could even form, but note that Alibaba's latest pullback didn't undercut the low of the prior base (164.25). That means any new base that forms would be the third-stage variety after a strong move in 2017. A general rule of thumb is to buy breakouts from early-stage bases, not later-stage patterns.Keep in mind that when stocks move they tend to move in groups, and that appears to be the case with China stocks in general. In the latest IBD 50, for example, buying demand has also dried up in China Lodging (HTHT), TAL Education (TAL) and Weibo (WB).For now, the top China name in the IBD 50 is Baozun (BZUN), which continues to hold near highs.RELATED:Alibaba Invests Another $2 Billion Into Leading SE Asia E-Commerce Site LazadaBest Growth Stocks To Buy And Watch: See Updates To IBD Stock ListsIPO Stock News And Analysis: Find Today's Top New Issues

Whether or not Walt Disney's (DIS) acquisition of 21st Century Fox's (FOXA) entertainment assets goes through, Disney CEO Bob Iger assured investors late Tuesday that the ESPN+ streaming service and the upcoming stand-alone Disney pay-TV platform would not be dependent on the deal.But without Fox, Hulu — jointly owned by Disney, Comcast (CMCSA)'s NBCUniversal, Time Warner (TWX) and Fox (for now, until Disney's acquisition of its entertainment assets is complete) — will be deprived of some content as Disney looks to pump the streaming service with more original programming.Iger nodded to that goal on the call, telling analysts that "much" of Hulu's future original programming would come from both Disney and Fox. The merger of assets would bring Fox shows such as "The Simpsons" and "Empire," to name a few, not to mention the entirety of FX Networks and National Geographic Channels under Disney's wing.Those remarks follow Hulu's update last week that it now has 20 million subscribers. That's still less than half of what Netflix (NFLX) claims stateside, but a formidable figure as the streaming platform stakes out its own turf in the entertainment arena and tries to build revenue streams in ways that its ad-less rival cannot.Hulu also inked a multiyear deal with DreamWorks Animation, stealing away the kids content creator from Netflix. Netflix said in December that it would release half a dozen original DreamWorks Animation Television series on the service in 2018.But Hulu's announcement last week means that it, too, will soon have DreamWorks content, and exclusive content at that. The platform and studio are teaming up to develop original kids and family series based on current DreamWorks franchises and movies, to be released in 2020. Starting next year, Hulu will be the only place where American viewers can watch DreamWorks movies such as "How To Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World" and "Trolls 2" online.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseIt's not clear what the impact will be on Netflix's DreamWorks series.Hulu has also renewed its critically acclaimed "The Handmaid's Tale" for a third season. The dystopian series, which became the first streaming show to win the Emmy for best drama, last week began its second season. Hulu claimed the season-two premiere doubled viewership vs. the first season.While Netflix has shied away from featuring ads, Hulu plans to debut "ad-supported downloadable content," in which advertisers can insert their commercials into shows and movies that users have downloaded on their devices. The company is also going to start offering ad space in its live-TV subscription service.Netflix shares edged up 0.2% to 326.89 in the  stock market today. Disney stock fell 0.7%, and slid further after hours following its earnings call.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN: These Stunning Stats Reveal Epic Netflix-Amazon-Hulu-Apple War To Come

Exxon Mobil (XOM) said it would focus on boosting shareholder value after missing earnings views for a second straight quarter Friday, as output slipped despite the recent surge in oil prices, while Chevron (CVX) topped profit forecasts.XExxon is focused on "growing shareholder value" as its first priority, then on investments and raising the dividend, before looking at share buybacks, said Jeff Woodbury, head of investor relations, during the company's first-quarter earnings call.But he added that buybacks "remain on the table" and will be looked at on a quarter-to-quarter basis.In the earnings release, the company also said it doesn't plan to use buybacks to reduce outstanding shares but will buy shares to offset dilution related to benefit plans and programs.With crude prices at the highest levels in more than three years, hopes have been higher that oil companies will return more capital to shareholders after years of being cautious with cash.But on Thursday Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) reported its highest profit since oil prices were above $100 a barrel, but declined to say when a planned $25 billion-$30 billion buyback would start and instead prioritized debt reduction.Exxon's cash flow from operations and asset sales rose 12.4% in Q1 to $9.96 billion, the highest since 2014. But earnings still disappointed, as EPS rose 14.7% to $1.09, missing analyst views by 5 cents. Revenue rose 7.8% to $68.2 billion, beating views for $66.07 billion.Oil-equivalent production fell 6% to 3.9 million barrels per day, the weakest Q1 tally since its 1999 merger. Adjusted production slipped 3%. Upstream revenue jumped 55% to $3.497 billion while downstream revenue fell nearly 16% to $940 million. Capital expenditures rose 16.7% to $4.867 billion.Exxon now has 27 rigs in the Permian Basin and four in the Bakken, with production up 18% in the two plays year over year.Woodbury said Exxon has made "great progress" in tight oil and the 27 rigs in the Permian is ahead of Exxon's schedule to have 30 rigs in the prolific basin by end of the year.The company hasn't seen any pipeline bottlenecks in the Permian. "We are clearing all of our Permian barrels," Woodbury said.Exxon Mobil shares fell 3.8% to close at 77.79 on the stock market today. Royal Dutch Shell dipped 0.8%, and BP (BP), which reports next week, fell 1.4%, slipping back under buy range.Get Free Access To IBD Digital Through April 29

Excluding working capital, cash flow from operations jumped 48% to $7.1 billion. Capital and exploratory expenditures were flat at $4.4 billion."Our cash flow continues to increase with the powerful combination of expanding upstream margins and volumes," Chairman and CEO Michael Wirth said in a statement. "Oil and gas production is increasing, most notably in our Gorgon and Wheatstone LNG Projects in Australia, and our shale developments in the Permian Basin where production grew 65% from a year ago."The company is still looking at swap options in the basin to help build out longer laterals. During the earnings call, CFO Pat Yarrington said there was a "modest reduction" in drilled but uncompleted wells (DUCs) in the Permian basin.Chevron shares rallied 1.9% to 126.62. The stock is building the right side of a cup base with a 133.98 entry point.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Energy Stocks And Industry News: Oil, Gas, Solar, CoalBest Growth Stocks To Buy And Watch: See Updates To IBD Stock ListsStocks To Buy And Watch: Top IPOs, Big And Small Caps, Growth StocksLooking For The Best Stocks To Buy And Watch? Crude oil prices eased Friday, notching its first weekly slip in three weeks. But prices have marched higher in eight of 10 months since June, as Saudi Arabia continues to orchestrate a disciplined production strategy outside the U.S. Plus, improving global economies gradually drive demand higher.The combination left Europe's Brent crude benchmark just below $74 a barrel on Friday, up 47% from a June low. U.S. crude oil prices have followed close behind. Investors haven't failed to notice, and oil stocks are in motion.The Oil & Gas-Integrated industry tracked by IBD rose 8% in the past week. That was despite group member Exxon Mobil's (XOM) steep post-earnings dive on Friday. Another Dow Jones stock, Chevron (CVX), is also in the group. But almost 75% of the group's 26 oil stocks are companies based outside of the U.S.Among those is Ecopetrol (EC), a Colombian-based producer listed on IBD's Global Leaders lineup. The integrated group also includes international heavyweights such as BP (BP), Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) and Suncor (SU). All of those oil stocks are in bases. Two of them have earnings due early in the week.Get Free Access To IBD Digital Through April 29

Company regulatory filings say it has been evolving "from a wholly state-owned entity to a mixed-economy company with private capital" since going public in the U.S. in 2008. Citigroup (C) rallied Tuesday after semi-activist investor ValueAct Capital Partners reportedly amassed a $1.2 billion stake, saying the banking giant could return more capital to shareholders and roughly double its earnings per share by 2020.But an analyst played down the move, citing ValueAct's "relatively passive" involvement in other financial companies that it partially owns. The analyst also indicated that ValueAct's EPS target for Citigroup could be tough to reach. However, he said ValueAct could press Citi to make an acquisition.In a letter to investors seen by the Wall Street Journal and Reuters, ValueAct isn't demanding major changes at Citigroup. The outlets reported the news on Monday.The fund said the bank could return some $50 billion to shareholders over the next two years, up from the company's plans for $40 billion, according to Reuters. And it said Citigroup could put up at least $10 in EPS by 2020, compared to the $5.33 it earned last year.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseBut Keefe, Bruyette & Woods analyst Brian Kleinhanzl pointed out that Citi has already planned to return $60 billion-plus over the next three yearly stress-test cycles, making the fund's projection "not new news." And he said that hitting that figure would require some massive profit growth on Citi's part."We estimate that even with a pull forward of capital return, Citi's net income would need to grow by 17% year over year in 2020 and that compares to the consensus estimate of +7% currently," he said in a research note Monday."Still," he said, "activist involvement is a net positive, in our view, and we believe that ValueAct's ownership stake may put a floor on shares of Citi while the position is held."The fund, in its letter, praised Citigroup's "old-fashioned treasury management for global businesses," according to the Journal, making the bank a crucial player in making the world's financial system work.Citigroup is more internationally exposed than other big U.S. banks. ValueAct said Citigroup's position on the international stage helped it generate steadier profits than those from investment banking, an area where Citi has at times lagged opponents, the Journal said.Citigroup jumped 3.7% to 71.02 in the stock market today, closing just above its 50-day line. JPMorgan Chase (JPM) rose 1.5% and Bank of America (BAC) 1%, both approaching their 50-day lines. Citi, JPMorgan and Bank of America are working on their third-straight advance.The fund also signaled that the future of banking might be — as the cliche goes — a bit more boring."We believe that in this era of banks, the winners and losers will be decided by strategic focus, customer-centric innovation, and capital allocation, as opposed to product breadth, appetite for risk and investment in trading talent that defined competition in the pre-crisis era," ValueAct said, according to the Journal.Banks like Morgan Stanley (MS), which ValueAct has also invested in, have focused more on their more stable wealth management business. Goldman Sachs (GS), while still known for its massive trading operations, has rolled out Marcus, an online consumer-lending platform.Kleinhanzl, in the KBW's research note, said that ValueAct could be looking bulk up on Citigroup at a discount."Geopolitical concerns have weighed on Citigroup this year and ValueAct may be taking advantage of the geopolitical uncertainty to establish a position, believing that fears will subside and shares will outperform," he said.And he said ValueAct could "also agitate for Citi to buy another company if ValueAct holds a position longer term or is able to get a board seat from Citigroup.""It should be noted that ValueAct also owns Alliance Data Systems (ADS) and there are complementary businesses between the two."Alliance Data Systems was up 1.3%. Goldman fell 0.1%. Morgan Stanley gained 1.9%.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley Lead Bank Stocks Breaking Support As Yield Woes ContinueNo Fed Rate Hike, But Here's Why The Dow Jones Can't Get A Head Of SteamBanks And Financial Stocks: Latest News And Analysis

Leading Chinese stocks came under fire in the recent market correction, but 58.com (WUBA) showed strong resilience. Now the former Leaderboard idea is nearing a potential entry in the stock market today and will look to break out amid the nascent market uptrend. Shares rose 0.2% in midday trade Wednesday.The China-based 58.com is the leader in the online classified ads market in China, similar to Craigslist in the U. S., and was a top stock in 2017.After two years of negative earnings, earnings per share soared into positive territory in 2017. Analysts expect that annual earnings growth to continue, with increases of 30% in 2018 and 43% in 2019.In the latest quarter, the company reported EPS of 57 cents — compared with a loss of two cents per share in the year-ago period. Meanwhile, quarterly revenue growth accelerated for the fourth straight quarter with a 41% increase. Accelerating earnings or sales are a sign of fundamental strength.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseAccording to Credit Suisse, 58.com's used-goods trading unit, Zhuan Zhuan, is showing strong momentum as it makes solid progress in its user and transaction bases. In its two years of operation, the unit's gross merchandise volume increased about 200%. In 2017, Chinese internet giant Tencent (TCEHY) took a $200 million stake in the unit.Meanwhile, operating margins on the company's core business — classified ads — remain solid, as automation and self-service platforms drive cost savings in its sales force.The analyst has a 96 price target and an outperform rating on the stock.After a 124% move from a 39.05 flat base a year ago, the stock is adding a handle to a cup-shaped base. The current base has an 86.09 buy point. Shares are about 4% away from the buy point.Volume has been noticeably light over the last month amid the stock's rebound from the 50-day line. Look for a big surge in volume if the stock approaches and surpasses its buy point, indicating institutions expect higher stock prices.The current base structure is the third-stage variety and will have less upside potential than earlier-stage formations.According to the IBD Stock Checkup, the stock has a B+ Accumulation/Distribution Rating, indicating strong institutional demand. Meanwhile, the relative strength line — inked in blue on every MarketSmith and IBD daily and weekly chart — is holding near its highs.RELATED:Alcoa, ASML, American Express Earnings Headline Investing Action PlanBest Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchHow To Trade: Why Apple, Nvidia Breakouts Still Worked Despite 'Light Volume'What Does This Breakout Stock Have In Common With Netflix, Nvidia, Grubhub?3 Rules For How To Buy Stocks Like Salesforce During Earnings Season

U.S.-listed China stocks were big losers in Friday's trading, including Alibaba (BABA), Baozun (BZUN), Weibo (WB), Sina (SINA), Tencent (TCEHY), Tal Education (EDU) were among the notable Chinese stocks underperforming the S&P 500 index, Nasdaq composite and Dow Jones industrial average. However, one new Chinese IPO, iQiyi (IQ) extended Thursday's breakout from a short IPO base.Autohome (ATHM) was one U.S.-listed China stock that held up reasonably well. Shares of the auto information site fell 2.65%, but from Thursday's record high. Autohome is well extended from a breakout.Baozun, Weibo and Tal Education are members of the IBD 50 list and a big reason why that elite list underperformed Friday.It wasn't clear what drove these China stocks lower. China reported a rare trade deficit in March as exports fell, raising concerns about economic growth.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseU.S.-China trade war tensions have ebbed for the moment, but these U.S.-listed Chinese stocks aren't that affected by trade. Alibaba is a Chinese e-commerce giant, but it doesn't have much exposure to the U.S. itself. That same goes for social site Weibo and for-profit school stock Tal Education.Chinese social sites do face the risk of running afoul of Chinese censors. Weibo said Friday that it was removing gay and violent content from its site. That comes after Web portal Toutiao pulled an app that regulators said was vulgar.But Chinese internets try hard to stay in Beijing's good graces, and act quickly when regulators crack down. Also, censor risks wouldn't seem to apply to Chinese stocks like Tal or Baozun, which helps Western brands with China e-commerce strategies.Perhaps China stocks were just out of favor. Whatever the reason, investors need to focus on the price and volume action of specific names, groups and the overall market.Baidu (BIDU) web streaming unit iQiyi, called the Netflix (NFLX) of China, rose 1.5% to 19.33, hitting a new high. Shares rose 5.4% to 19.04 on Thursday, clearing a very short IPO base with an 18.62 buy point. The 5% buy zone extends to 19.55.IQiyi not only emulates Netflix in a broad sense, it licenses Netflix content.As for parent Baidu, shares fell 1.4%, continuing to find resistance at its 200-day line.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Stock Market Futures Rally After Syria 'Mission Accomplished'These 5 Tech Titans Just Carved This Bullish PatternThese IBD 50 Companies Will Post 40%-Plus Earnings GrowthBest Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchSpotify IPO: See Lessons From Facebook, Alibaba, Snap Before BuyingThese 2 Biotech Stocks Break Out, 3 Others Hold Near Buy Points

Oil prices finished higher Wednesday despite a surprise increase in U.S. crude supplies last week and another fresh high in crude production.XThe Energy Information Administration said U.S. crude inventories rose by 2.2 million barrels during the week ending April 20. Analysts polled by S&P Global Platts had forecast the government to report a 1.1 million-barrel drop in the nation's oil stockpiles.On Tuesday, data from the American Petroleum Institute, a trade group, showed that crude supply increased 1.1 million barrels last week.Domestic production last week rose to 10.59 million barrels per day, a 46,000 barrel increase, according to EIA.West Texas Intermediate rose 0.5% to settle at $68.05 a barrel, after initially reversing lower on the inventory data.Exxon Mobil (XOM) rallied 1.5% in the stock market today. Chevron (CVX) rose 0.15%, Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) added 0.1%, and BP (BP) dropped 0.2%.Get Free Access To IBD Digital Through April 29

Shares in Sprint (S) and T-Mobile US (TMUS) climbed in after-hours trading Thursday on a report that parents SoftBank and Deutsche Telekom (DTEGY) may finally be close to hammering out a merger deal between the two U.S. wireless service providers.XThe companies are racing to seal a deal before they report earnings next week, Reuters reported. Sprint is set to report fiscal fourth-quarter results on May 2. Ownership would be structured so that Deutsche Telekom could consolidate the combined financial results of T-Mobile and Sprint, the report said.Sprint rose 8.5% to 6.52 in late trading on the stock market today. T-Mobile gained 3.7% to 66.50. Shares in cellphone tower operators Crown Castle (CCI), American Tower (AMT) and SBA Communications (SBAC) were down a fraction.

Casino operator Wynn Resorts (WYNN) on Tuesday reported first-quarter earnings that topped estimates after the market close, and the company announced a dividend increase. But revenue missed some estimates.XEstimates: Earnings per share to jump 58% to $1.96, on revenue of $1.709 billion, up 16%, according to Zacks Investment Research. FactSet had expected $1.75 billion in revenue.Results: Revenue of $1.72 billion, up 20.5%, helped by its Macau-based Wynn Palace and Wynn Macau resorts, as well as its business in Las Vegas. Earnings per share came in at $2.30.Wynn said it approved a 75-cent per-share cash dividend, payable May 29 to shareholders of record as of May 17, marking a 50% increase from the prior quarter. The move, the company said, reflected "ongoing strength and stability across our operations."Stock: Shares drifted 0.8% lower after hours on the stock market today, dropping back out of buy range after initially clearing a cup-with-handle base with a 192.85 buy point last week.Las Vegas Sands (LVS), which reports Wednesday, up 0.1% late. Hong Kong-based Melco Resorts & Entertainment (MLCO) was unchanged after the bell, easing back into buy range. More U.S.-focused MGM Resorts International (MGM), whose hotel-resorts line the Las Vegas Strip, was also inactive after the close. MGM reports Thursday.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseGaming sales in Macau, the world's gambling epicenter, rose during the first quarter, surpassing expectations in January and March but coming up short in February. During the fourth quarter, Wynn's earnings nearly tripled on gaming results from the region, which is the only place in China where gambling is legal.Still, much of the focus for Wynn Resorts seems likely to be on the fallout from CEO Steve Wynn's departure, following allegations of sexual misconduct. Steve Wynn has since agreed to sell his stake in the company, and the company has said it plans to sell new shares to Galaxy Entertainment Group, which operates resorts in Macau.The developments have raised the prospect that Wynn Resorts could be sold. MGM is said to be mulling a bid for the company. The Wall Street Journal reported that Wynn was discussing selling its Boston Harbor resort to MGM. Regulators in Massachusetts and Nevada are looking into the allegations against Steve Wynn.In the company's earnings release, Wynn said it expected Wynn Boston Harbor to open in the middle of next year.Wynn Resorts has cited its "dependence on Stephen A. Wynn" as a risk to its business.The company has named three women to its board, following a demand for a shakeup from Elaine Wynn, Steve Wynn's ex-wife, who is also the company's biggest shareholder and one of its original founders. In a regulatory filing on Monday, she urged shareholders not to re-elect John Hagenbuch to the company's board.Hagenbuch is a member of a special committee formed to investigate the allegations against Steve Wynn. Elaine Wynn, in a letter to shareholders, said that Hagenbuch was a "longtime close friend" of Steve Wynn, adding, "I find this obvious conflict deeply troubling."Wynn Resorts, in response to the letter, said it was "continuing the positive momentum that has accompanied its recent initiatives and is focused on the future."YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Online Poker Giant Makes Sports Betting Gamble With $4.7 Billion DealMGM Resorts International Trying To Close In On Key Technical BenchmarkStocks Flashing Renewed Technical Strength: Las Vegas Sands

Walmart (WMT) may acquire a stake as high as 80% in Flipkart, giving it a leg up against rival Amazon (AMZN) in an emerging market of 1.3 billion people.XA recent report had said Walmart was in talks to take a Flipkart stake that "could go up to 50% or 60%." Flipkart, the most valuable startup in India, is worth about $20 billion.But a report from Bloomberg late Sunday suggested the company may be poised to gain a 60%-80% stake, with major Flipkart investor SoftBank Group offloading a substantial part of its roughly 20% holding. Walmart would pay at least $12 billion for a majority interest in Flipkart and the deal could be inked within two weeks.Walmart likely faces fewer regulatory hurdles because it currently has no online retail presence in India, while Amazon is already the second-largest e-commerce player and Flipkart's primary rival, the report added.The two behemoths have been locked in a battle for the Indian e-commerce portal since early this year.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseFlipkart's major investors are now aligning with Walmart after considering an Amazon purchase, unnamed sources told Bloomberg.Besides Japan's SoftBank, those major investors reportedly include eBay (EBAY), Microsoft (MSFT) and Tencent Holdings (TCEHY).Shares of Walmart shed 1% to 86.10 on the stock market today, while Amazon lost 0.6% at 1,517.86. EBay fell 1.4% Monday, Microsoft added 0.4% and Tencent lost 0.3%.World's largest retailer Walmart is ramping up its online strategy at home and abroad as consumers migrate to online commerce, driven by Amazon.It has not been decided whether Flipkart's founders will continue to lead the business after the Walmart purchase. The final stake could change, and the talks could fall apart, the report said.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Amazon Vs. Walmart: Locking Horns In A Battle For Retail's FutureWill The Stock Market Rally Continue? Watch These Four FactorsCould Big Tobacco Become Big Cannabis As Marijuana Business Soars?

With an oil renaissance underway in the United States, it's a good time to be a refiner, especially when you're HollyFrontier (HFC) and at the forefront of American energy stocks.As favorable economic conditions fatten margins, HollyFrontier's shares are surging. It's sitting in a sweet spot, reaping the benefit of low acquisition costs for crude oil. Yet it sells refined petroleum under a higher pricing standard."The whole refining space is the beneficiary of a fairly wide spread between Brent crude oil in Europe and the North American-based WTI (West Texas Intermediate) crude oil," CFRA analyst Stewart Glickman told Investor's Business Daily.The current pricing dynamic for Dallas-based HollyFrontier is simple. The company says 100% of its purchased crude barrels are WTI-based. That means its local crude acquisition costs are driven off what is now a low WTI price. But once it refines the product and sends it out to customers like Shell (RDSA) — one of its biggest customers — it's able to sell into global markets under the more costly Brent standard under which overseas refiners operate.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseRight now, that gap is roughly $5 a barrel, and Glickman says the spread is widening. That can be attributed to "fairly good" compliance with output cuts by OPEC and Russia. Further, U.S. shale production that has "surprised to the upside," Glickman said.Another thing working in HollyFrontier's favor is the location of its refineries, mostly in the middle of the U.S. Analysts say it's unusual compared with other refiners, many of whom are centered in the Gulf Coast region."Although it's smaller than its Gulf Coast peers, (HollyFrontier's) refineries are competitively well positioned," Morningstar analyst Allen Good said in a Feb. 22 report.HollyFrontier operates five refineries across the U.S., located in Wyoming, Utah, Kansas, Oklahoma and New Mexico. In particular, a competitive advantage for HollyFrontier is its proximity to the Canadian border."Canadian crude is extremely price disadvantaged right now," Glickman noted. "If you are a Canadian producer trying to export your crude to the U.S., there's an awful lot of production and very little take-away capacity."That results in even lower initial crude prices, and "that disadvantage for Canada works in HollyFrontier's favor," Glickman said.Of the 450,000 to 470,000 barrels per day HollyFrontier refines, some 80,000 to 100,000 barrels of that are from Canada. The other base oil comes from the Bakken shale formation, Permian Basin and other hot shale-drilling spots.HollyFrontier stock broke out of a cup-with-handle base with a 50.60 buy point on April 4. Volume on the breakout was lighter than average, which isn't ideal. Heavy volume on a breakout indicates institutional support.Still, the relative strength line hit a new high before the stock hit a new price high, which is bullish. The line is continuing higher along the run. The relative strength line measures a stock's price performance vs. the S&P 500.Shares are now extended roughly 15% from the buy point, and were flat in Friday trading to near 58.25.While energy stocks have been on a steady climb as of late, oil refining is a "volatile and competitive" industry, Glickman said in a March 22 report.For now, that volatility has been to the upside. Crude oil prices hit a more than three-year high of $69 per barrel Thursday. According to S&P Global Platts-owned PIRA Energy Group, the projected price for WTI is $68 per barrel this year and $63 per barrel in 2019.The volatility of the price of crude has an impact on energy stocks. Glickman says, though, it's less important if WTI "slips a bit" than if the spread between it and Brent remains high."As long as that spread remains high, (HollyFrontier) should be fine," he said.Morningstar's Good expects the spread "to remain wider than historical levels (before 2010) when WTI and Brent traded close to par. Ultimately, we think the transportation costs to move light crude from the midcontinent to the Gulf Coast result in a long-term WTI average differential to Brent of $5 per barrel."HollyFrontier primarily plays in the downstream, or refining, space. Through its majority stake in master limited partnership Holly Energy Partners (HEP), it also has midstream, or transportation and storage, operations.Glickman notes that the MLP model itself is not a concern. But the increasing level of distributable cash flow, which HollyFrontier benefits from as the general partner, could potentially result in Holly Energy Partner's abandonment of the MLP structure.Aside from its relationship with Holly Energy Partners and crude-margin tightening, another potential concern for HollyFrontier is regulatory risk. A new regulation that makes it more difficult for HollyFrontier to obtain, ship or refine product could weigh on margins, Glickman said. But he also noted that risk is "part and parcel" for any investment in the oil and gas industry.The shale boom in recent years has no doubt reinvigorated the oil and gas industry in the United States."Shale has a seat at the big-boy table," Maynard Holt, chief executive of energy industry-focused investment bank Tudor, Pickering, Holt & Co., told IBD at the CERAWeek oil and gas conference in Houston earlier this year. "Shale is here, it's in a politically stable place which just improved its tax regime, where services are plenty, were labor is plenty, where you deal with landowners and not governments. It is arguably the best place on the planet if you're choosing where you want to invest (in the oil industry)."HollyFrontier is seeing a big benefit from corporate tax reform, with its rate shrinking to 21% from 35%."The reforms to the U.S. tax code encourage capital investments and lower the corporate rate to better enable manufacturers to compete in the global market," HollyFrontier Chief Executive George Damiris said during the company's fourth-quarter earnings call on Feb. 21.HollyFrontier is increasing its capital expenditures this year to $450 million from $275 million in 2017. While that is a "big step up," Glickman says this is a "very acceptable problem" since the company is generating over $1 billion in cash flow.Another way HollyFrontier could get more competitive vs. other energy stocks would be through an acquisition. But the company is being decidedly conservative on that front."We've seen a number of deals in 2017 that we participated in the process but didn't end up winning, obviously, otherwise we'd have announced the deal. We're going to continue to look and only pull the trigger when we see value," Damiris said on the call.HollyFrontier is set to issue first-quarter results before the open on May 2. The company is expected to swing to a profit of 38 cents a share vs. a loss of 19 cents a share last year, according to analysts with Zacks Investment Research. Revenue is projected to rise 9% to $3.36 billion, a deceleration from the prior quarter's 35% sales growth.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Energy Stocks And Industry News: Oil, Gas, Solar, CoalStocks To Buy And Watch: Top IPOs, Big And Small Caps, Growth StocksCrude Oil Prices Are Up Sharply, But Is The Bakken Shale Play Back?

In a damaging week for many stock charts, especially in technology industries, internet retailers posted one of the largest gains among industry groups. Small-cap Carvana (CVNA) led the charge, rising about 25% for the week. But large-cap internet names — led by Amazon.com (AMZN), eBay (EBAY) and Alibaba Group Holdings (BABA) — also made significant moves.In addition, those same big-cap stocks have led the industry in shaping a fresh round of bases. The result leaves two of the three trading below potential buy points in valid bases with their quarterly reports due in the coming week.Amazon is forming a cup base with a 1,617.64 buy point. A boost came on Friday from a Credit Suisse hike of the stock's price target to 1,800 from 1,750. The report considered Amazon "one of the best positioned (e-commerce names) to capture the next wave of retail dollars coming online."Amazon on Tuesday retook support at its 50-day moving average. The consolidation was more than 15% deep. That disqualified the pattern as a flat base, making six weeks the minimum length for a valid cup base. The stock is in a opportunistic position, just ahead of its earnings report. Amazon plans to report after the market closes on Thursday.A note of caution: Amazon's base is a very late-stage piece of work. That adds risk to any potential breakout. But the rule-warping Amazon has been breaking out from late-stage patterns since March 2017. It has gained 82% in the process.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseEBay also retook its 50-day moving average during the week. That moved it closer to a 44.40 buy point in a double-bottom base.That positions the auction website well ahead of its first-quarter earnings report, scheduled after Wednesday's closing bell.EBay earned a double upgrade from Morgan Stanley based on its payment processing partnership with Netherlands-base Adyen. Morgan Stanley's report on Wednesday rated the stock overweight, two notches up from underweight. The brokerage hoisted the stock's price target more than 60%, to 58 from 36.EBay's base is a second-stage pattern. This suggests the stock's advance from a breakout should have more room to run before requiring a significant correction.China's Alibaba Group may also be forming a double-bottom base. But it still needs to punch past its 10-week moving average. The possible buy point is 201.60.Alibaba's first-quarter report is due May 4.Photography websites Shutterstock (SSTK) and Shutterfly (SFLY) are forming flat bases. Shutterstock's buy point is at 52.88, and the company reports Q1 results Thursday morning. The buy point for Shutterfly is 86.51. Its earnings are due May 1.RELATED:EBay Shares Jump On Big Upgrade Over Payments Processing TransitionBest Growth Stocks To Buy And Watch: See Updates To IBD Stock ListsStocks To Buy And Watch: Top IPOs, Big And Small Caps, Growth StocksLooking For The Best Stocks To Buy And Watch? An analyst says the social media platforms of Tencent Holdings (TCEHY) are being underestimated as he initiated coverage Thursday on one of China's largest internet companies and a leader in gaming, messaging and digital media.KeyBanc Capital Markets analyst Hans Chung gave Tencent an overweight rating put a price target at the equivalent of roughly $71 for the company on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. That's a premium of around 40% from where the stock currently trades in Hong Kong. Tencent also trades on the U.S. over-the-counter market, where shares were up 0.7%, near 53, in morning action on the stock market today."We believe the Street is underestimating Tencent's social media platforms," Chung wrote. "Tencent dominates consumer engagement and has a variety of tools for businesses to reach consumers."Tencent is the largest company in China by market valuation, currently near $500 billion. It is also China's largest provider of online music, video and literature, and has the largest mobile web browser and app store in China.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe other internet leaders in China are Alibaba (BABA) and JD.com (JD), which are the two largest e-commerce companies in China, and Baidu (BIDU), the leading provider of search engine services. Tencent, Alibaba, JD.com and Baidu are among the best Chinese stocks to buy and watch.Tencent is perhaps best known for its WeChat mobile platform, which has more than 1 billion users. WeChat is a multipurpose messaging and social media app. It also serves as a payment system, with numerous other functions and platforms."We believe all of Tencent's mobile platforms combined account for more than 50% of total mobile user spent time in the country," Chung said in a research note to clients. "This drives extraordinary consumer engagement and makes Tencent the most powerful clearing house for interactions between consumers and businesses of all sizes."Tencent reported fourth-quarter earnings ahead of expectations last month, as revenue rose 51% in local currency from the year-ago period to $10.16 billion. In comparison, JD.com reported revenue of $16.9 billion for its fourth quarter, while Alibaba reported revenue of $12.8 billion with Baidu at $3.6 billion.Chinese regulators have been working on enabling China companies trading abroad, such as Alibaba, JD.com, Baidu and Tencent, to list at home. Investors may want to keep a close eye on China's rapidly evolving stock markets. China's top stock exchanges, in Hong Kong, Shanghai and Shenzhen, are linking up to create what is now the world's second-largest stock market, in terms of valuation of listed companies.Shares of Alibaba ticked up 0.3% to close at 172.57. JD.com gained 1.9% to 40.19, while Baidu added 0.6% to 225.57.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Tencent Dives As Major Investor Unloads Shares Worth $10.6 BillionBaidu Rated Neutral, Artificial Intelligence Payoff Not Coming SoonJD.com Has These Futuristic Projects In The WorksAlibaba Listing In China Would Fuel New Opportunities For Investors
