U.S. stock indexes advanced early Wednesday as GDP matched the consensus expectation. Meanwhile, India's GDP came in at 7.2%, giving it the title for the world's fastest growing major economy.X The Nasdaq popped 0.4%, while the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones industrial average rose 0.3% and 0.4% respectively.Volume in the stock market today was up slightly on the Nasdaq.The second reading on fourth quarter GDP rolled in at 2.5%, matching the Street's consensus view. Recent GDP releases have sparked all-or-nothing reactions in the stock market. In the past 10 GDP releases not including Wednesday's report, the Nasdaq either rose or fell by more than 1% five times and rose or fell by 0.1% or less five times.India also reported its Q4 GDP this morning. The 7.2% spurt was higher than the 6.9% gain that analysts expected. India's growth surpassed China's 6.8% Q4 gain to grab the lead position among major economies.Barclays iPath India (INP) benchmark exchange traded fund is down 3% year to date after rising 41% last year.Among the India stocks trading on U.S. exchanges, three have Composite Ratings of 91 or better. The Composite Rating combines all five IBD ratings into a single number. A rating of 91 means the stock is in the top 9%.The three highly rated India stocks are HDFC Bank (HDB), which carries a 91 Composite Rating; tech services provider Infosys (INFY), which is rated 94; and outsourcer WNS Holdings (WNS), which is rated a best possible 99.WNS has shaped a base-on-base pattern with a 46.10 buy point.In the 30-component Dow Jones industrial average, Apple (AAPL) advanced 0.7%, staying just under a recent high. Boeing (BA) rose 1.8%, marking a new high.Among IBD's 197 industry groups, Retail-Apparel/Shoes scored strong gain. TJX Companies (TJX) gapped up 7% to a new high. Urban Outfitters (URBN) and American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) notched solid gains but remain in their 5% buy zone.Chicago's purchasing managers index for February came in at 61.9, below the consensus figure of 65 and under the lowest estimate (62) in the range. The Chicago gauge measures both manufacturing and nonmanufacturing firms.The National Association of Realtors' pending home sales for January dived 4.7%, badly missing the consensus estimate for a 0.3% gain.RELATED:TJX Raises Dividend 25%Crocs Misses On Q4 Results

Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) is taking an "overly optimistic" long-term view of its business, an analyst said after the firm offered a mixed fourth-quarter report and called for 2018 to be a down year.X Guidance for 2018 sales of $8.1 billion to $8.3 billion — vs. analyst views for $8.38 billion — is conservative given it reflects the potential Valeant's ulcerative colitis drugs Apriso and Uceris will lose exclusivity, Piper Jaffray analyst David Amsellem said.But Valeant's guidance for U.S. dermatology business to double by 2022 vs. 2017 is likely "overly rosy," Amsellem said in a note to clients. He doubted Valeant's call for 2018 to be a trough year. The picture only worsens in 2020 with significant debt maturing, he said."Though it is not lost on us that Valeant has a brisk pace of new/upcoming launches, we believe that Valeant's aspirational target for doubling U.S. dermatology sales by 2022 vs. 2017 is overly optimistic," he said.Mizuho analyst Irina Koffler deemed Valeant's outlook "optimistic" for a 5%-8% compound annual growth rate in adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and appreciation from 2018-21.Valeant shares collapsed 11.4% Wednesday following the company's fourth-quarter report and were still in free fall on Thursday. On the stock market today, Valeant toppled another 6.9% to close at 15.26, after diving as much as 7.5% in earlier trades.Valeant is bullish on a combination of the drugs retinoid tazarotene and halobetasol called Duobrii for plaque psoriasis. But generics of tazarotene, like Allergan's (AGN) Tazorac, are now available, though higher-concentration versions of halobetasol are not widely available."There are a number of other higher-concentration topical steroids that are generically available," he said. "Put another way, Duobrii might be efficacious and well-tolerated, but there are economic/payer realities to consider."Over the next five years, Valeant expects its "significant seven" drugs to grow to north of $1 billion from around $100 million. Among those, Valeant counts therapies for psoriasis, opioid-induced constipation and glaucoma.But it will have to square off vs. Allergan in psoriasis, AstraZeneca (AZN) and Purdue Pharmaceuticals in opioid-induced constipation, and Aerie Pharmaceuticals (AERI) in glaucoma, Amsellem said. He cut his price target to 10 from 12.RELATED:How To Invest In Stocks For Free: New Apps Aim For BeginnersSell And Take Profits Or Hold? Here Are Several Guidelines To FollowStill The No. 1 Rule For Stock Investors: Always Cut Your Losses Short

Tesaro (TSRO) crashed to a two-year low Wednesday after its biggest moneymaker fell short in the fourth quarter and the biotech said it would suspend distribution of another drug.X Sales of Zejula, an ovarian cancer drug, came in at $43.4 million, below the consensus for about $46 million, according to several analyst reports. Zejula competes with AstraZeneca's (AZN) Lynparza and Clovis Oncology's (CLVS) Rubraca.That puts Tesaro's guidance for $255 million to $275 million in 2018 sales of Zejula in doubt, Piper Jaffray analyst Christopher Raymond said in a note to clients. Raymond predicts just $250 million in full-year sales of the drug, known as a PARP inhibitor."We continue to think increasing interchangeability of marketed PARP inhibitors on the (effectiveness) front and what may also be a safety disadvantage for Zejula could serve as a drag on this guidance," he said.On the stock market today, Tesaro plunged 10.3% to close at 55.23, after earlier losing as much as 15.2%. Shares hit their lowest point since July 2016. AstraZeneca sank 1.9% to finish at 33.19. Clovis lost 1.8% to 58.07.RBC analyst Kennen MacKay also "dramatically cut" his views of Zejula to $228 million for 2018. Tesaro's outlook is challenging as it requires 17%-29% sequential growth each period from the second quarter through the fourth based on first-quarter guidance, he said in a note."Our updated 2018 Zejula estimates of $228 million are well below guidance of $255 million to $275 million as we anticipate emerging competition could add additional competitive headwinds to Zejula," he said.In addition, Tesaro said it would suspend distribution of the intravenous formula for Varubi, a treatment for nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy, due to post-marketing cases of allergic reaction and hypersensitivity.Analysts were surprised by the decision. Credit Suisse analyst Alethia Young, following a follow-up conversation with Tesaro, said the problem is likely due to a type of emulsifier used in Varubi rather than the drug itself."However, to circumvent this problem, the company would need to do additional trials with a different formulation and at this point the company would prefer to focus its resources on Zejula development," she said in a report.Young removed expectations for $150 million in Varubi IV sales in 2025 from her model. Leerink analyst Seamus Fernandez, similarly, had only modeled $150 million in peak 2026 sales of Varubi IV. He also eliminated it from his model in 2019 and beyond."Overall, we think that this makes sense, though we view this update as a surprise," Credit Suisse's Young said.RELATED:Veeva Rockets After Topping Quarterly Estimates, Crushing Guidance ViewsHow Celgene 'Gambled' On Ozanimod — And Why It Didn't Pay OffCelgene Tanks After FDA Refuses To Review Multiple Sclerosis Drug

Baidu (BIDU), oft-called the Google of China, is taking its Netflix (NFLX)-like video streaming service public in the U.S.X The service, iQiyi, aims to raise at least $1.5 billion in the initial public offering, filed late Tuesday. IQiyi will trade under the ticker IQ.With 50 million subscribers, iQiyi has about 28% market share in China, said Karen Chan, a Jefferies analyst in a report. Unlike Netflix, iQiyi sells advertising."Online advertising grew 44% in 2017 to $1.3 billion (47% of total revenue), largely on par with industry average," added Chan in a report. "This is largely driven by 16.3% year-over-year increase in average brand ad revenue per advertiser and in-feed ad service launched in 2016."IQiyi accounts for roughly 20% of Baidu's revenue. For the sake of comparison, Google-parent Alphabet (GOOGL) doesn't break out YouTube's financials., but brokerage William Blair estimates YouTube's 2018 revenue at $18.4 billion, about 14% of Google's revenue.The William Blair report, published Wednesday, estimates that while YouTube turned profitable in 2014, iQiyi hasn't yet turned an annual profit, according to its IPO filing. Cash burn on acquisition of licensed content has been a drag on free cash flow, similar to Netflix.In 2017, iQiyi had a loss of $592 million with revenue of $2.75 billion, up 54% from a year earlier.IQiyi's on-demand video content is similar to Netflix and provides TV shows and movies. Like Netflix, iQiyi uses artificial intelligence tools to make programming recommendations to subscribers.Baidu currently holds 69.6% stake in iQiyi and will remain as a majority shareholder post-IPO.New York Stock Exchange-listed shares in Baidu rose 0.8% to close at 252.34 on the stock market today.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:JD.com Launches Effort To Advance Artificial Intelligence, BlockchainBest Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchTop Chinese Internet Stock Builds New Base, Earns Rating UpgradeAlibaba To Buy Stakes Of Baidu, Others In Food Delivery Service

Tesaro (TSRO) crashed more than 10% late Tuesday on disappointing fourth-quarter results after sales of its cancer drug Zejula missed Wall Street expectations by $3 million and the company's guidance for 2018 came in well below views.In after-hours trading on the stock market today, Tesaro toppled 11.2% after shares closed the regular session up 3%, at 61.55. Shares have lost more than a quarter of their value since the beginning of the year as Tesaro's biggest drug faces challenges from AstraZeneca (AZN) and Clovis Oncology (CLVS).Zejula belongs to a class called PARP inhibitors, which treat ovarian cancer in some patients. During the fourth quarter, Zejula brought in $43.4 million in sales, missing expectations for $46 million, Piper Jaffray analyst Christopher Raymond said in a note to clients."Recall at the end of last year, there was a one-week lag between the announcement and effective date of a Zejula price increase, which could have resulted in an inventory build," he said. "No mention of inventory in the press release, but by our math, a week of inventory could be about $4 million."Total sales of $48 million for the fourth quarter missed the views of analysts polled by Zacks Investment Research for $52 million. Adjusted losses of $3.35 per share widened from losses of $2.59 in the year-earlier period and missed expectations for an adjusted loss of $2.41.Sales of a drug called Varubi, which aims to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy, were a bit light, Raymond said, at $4.5 million vs. the consensus view for $5.7 million. Revenue from Varubi grew 95% year over year, though.For the year, Tesaro guided to $310 million to $345 million in total sales, lagging the consensus for $388 million. Zejula sales guidance for $255 million to $275 million is well below the consensus for $307 million, Raymond said, noting he had modeled $285 million.RELATED:Jazz Pharma's Fourth-Quarter Sales, Profit Lag; Guidance MixedVeeva Rockets After Topping Quarterly Estimates, Crushing Guidance ViewsThese Biotechs Diverge After Biggest Moneymakers Lag Expectations

One of China's largest e-commerce companies, JD.com (JD), has launched a new effort to accelerate the advancement of artificial intelligence and blockchain technology.XThe new business accelerator, called AI Catapult, will partner with blockchain startups to develop and test applications and build new businesses, JD.com announced. JD already has an AI development program, which has focused on drones, robotics, automated machinery and supply chain technology. JD is also using blockchain technology for product and food safety.AI Catapult, which will be based in Beijing, starts with an inaugural roster of companies that have already made advances in their field. They include the Chinese fintech pioneer Bankorous; Australia's cryptocurrency leader CanYa; Bluezelle, the blockchain-powered database service based in Singapore; London-based Nuggets, the e-commerce payments and ID platform built on blockchain; and Devery, a blockchain powered, open-source, product verification protocol. CanYa recently completed Australia's second-largest initial coin offering, raising $12 million in cryptocurrency Ethereum over a 30-day period.In December, JD.com, Walmart (WMT) IBM (IBM), and Tsinghua University announced they had formed an alliance to leverage blockchain to help enhance food safety. IBM and Walmart, in August, announced a new consortium to enhance food safety, using IBM's blockchain technology.IBD'S TAKE: A wave of venture capital investment is pouring into blockchain technology startups, many of them directly involved in Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies. But a growing number of blockchain startups aim to harness the technology for a long and list of other purposes in private industry.In January, IBM teamed up with the world's largest container shipping company, A.P. Moller-Maersk, to provide a new platform for conducting global trade using blockchain technology.Shares of JD.com tumbled by 3.6% to close at 47.04 on the stock market today. JD.com is set to report quarterly earnings before the market open on Friday.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Seagate Stock Soars On Report Of Investment In Ripple CryptocurrencyBitcoin And Cryptocurrency News And Trends

China-based iQiyi (IQ), a spinoff from Baidu (BIDU), raised $2.25 billion late Wednesday with an initial public offering that priced roughly 125 million shares at $18, it was reported.XReuters said late Wednesday that the Beijing-based company, considered the Netflix (NFLX) of China, trades Thursday on the Nasdaq under the ticker IQ. The pricing came in at the midpoint of the expected range of 17 to 19 a share.The video streamer reported having 50.8 million paying subscribers at the end of 2017, up from 30.2 million the prior year. Its market share is near 28% in China.IQiyi's on-demand video content is similar to Netflix, with TV shows and movies. Like Netflix, it uses artificial intelligence tools to make programming recommendations to subscribers.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseIt also accounts for about 20% of Baidu's revenue. Baidu currently holds a 69.6% stake in the company and will remain as a majority shareholder post-IPO.In 2017, iQiyi reported revenue of $2.67 billion, up 55% from the previous year, and a net loss of $574 million, according to the IPO prospectus. The company was founded in 2010.Rivals Alibaba (BABA) and Tencent (TCEHY) have their own streaming services in a hotly contested battle for viewers. Alibaba was the largest IPO of a China-based company on a U.S. exchange, raising $25 billion.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Baidu Spinoff iQiyi Ready For Big Initial Public OfferingBaidu's iQiyi Sets IPO; Here's How It Stacks Up With Netflix, YouTubeYear's Biggest IPO iQiyi, Adobe, Lululemon: Investing Action PlanHot IPO Stocks: Canada Goose, Smart Global Shape Up As Dropbox, Baidu's iQiyi Grab Spotlight

In the largest initial public offering of a China company since the debut of Alibaba (BABA) in 2014, Beijing-based iQiyi (IQ) is set to begin trading Thursday.Spun off by China-based Baidu (BIDU) and considered the Netflix (NFLX) of China, iQiyi looks to raise $2.3 billion by offering 125 million shares at a price range of 17-19. That would provide a fully diluted market value of $13.7 billion.The company accounts for roughly 20% of Baidu's revenue. Baidu currently holds a 69.6% stake in the company and will remain as a majority shareholder post-IPO.Shares should price late Wednesday and begin trading Thursday on the Nasdaq under the ticker IQ. The lead underwriters are Goldman Sachs and Credit Suisse.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseWith 50 million subscribers, iQiyi has roughly a 28% market share in China.Rivals Alibaba (BABA) and Tencent (TCEHY) have their own streaming services in a hotly contested battle for viewers. Alibaba was the largest IPO of a China-based company on a U.S. exchange, raising $25 billion.IPO research and advisory firm IPOboutique.com issued a cautionary report on iQiyi Wednesday. On the plus side, it said, channel checks suggest the request for shares is strong, with the IPO being "many multiple-times oversubscribed," according to underwriter guidance.But the performance of other recent China IPOs "does not provide any boost of confidence for IPOs coming from China," the research firm said. Among these IPOs is Bilibili (BILI), which began trading on the Nasdaq on Wednesday.Bilibili provides an online entertainment platform serving young generations in China with 72 million monthly visitors. The company raised $483 million by offering 42 million shares at 11.50, within the range of 10.50 to 12.50. Shares fell to 9.62 and closed at 11.24.Another is China-based OneSmart International Education Group (ONE), which also began trading Wednesday. OneSmart raised $179 million, pricing 16.3 million American Depositary Shares at 11, the low end of its range. Shares closed at 10.80.Two other recent China IPOs, Sunlands Online Education (STG) and GreenTree Hospitality (GHG), both closed below their IPO price on the first day of trading.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Baidu's iQiyi Sets IPO; Here's How It Stacks Up With Netflix, YouTubeYear's Biggest IPO iQiyi, Adobe, Lululemon: Investing Action PlanHot IPO Stocks: Canada Goose, Smart Global Shape Up As Dropbox, Baidu's iQiyi Grab Spotlight

Incyte (INCY) plummeted Friday after a regimen that combines its immuno-oncology drug with another from Merck (MRK) failed in a late-stage study, prompting the duo to scrap the program.Raymond James analyst Reni Benjamin minced his price target on Incyte to 85 from 159, noting other combinations using Incyte's drug epacadostat with immuno-oncology drugs from Merck, Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY) and AstraZeneca (AZN) are also likely to be duds."In our view, this event taints the entire epacadostat franchise and therefore we are removing all revenues associated with melanoma and other indications from our models," he wrote in a report to clients. The study "missed big time."Shares of Incyte crashed by 22.9% to close at 64.02 on the stock market today. Incyte hit a two-year low, falling as much as 23.2%. Merck, a Dow Jones component, saw shares fall 2.2%, to 53.36. In sympathy, Bristol lost 2.3% to 60.88. AstraZeneca, though, lifted a fraction to 35.42.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe regimen failed to improve progression-free survival in melanoma patients, and looked unlikely to have an impact on overall survival, Incyte said in a news release. The combination tested epacadostat, which inhibits the IDO1 enzyme, with Merck's Keytruda, a PD-1 protein inhibitor.Data from the study will help contribute to the overall understanding of IDO1 inhibition in combination with a PD-1 checkpoint inhibitor, Incyte Chief Medical Officer Steven Stein said."We remain dedicated to transforming the treatment of cancer and will continue to explore how IDO1 inhibition and other novel mechanisms can potentially improve outcomes for patients in need," he said in a written statement.Safety from the combination was in line with previous studies, Incyte said. Patients will move off the regimen "in a manner consistent with the best interests of each patient."Incyte is also testing epacadostat in lung cancer patients in combinations with Merck, Bristol and AstraZeneca. Investigators are also looking at epacadostat regimens in kidney, head-and-neck and bladder cancers.Analysts had been bullish on Incyte's chances with epacadostat. Broadly, they theorize that combining immuno-oncology drugs could offer a more potent cancer response.Bristol has been at the forefront of combining immuno-oncology drugs. Its Opdivo, another PD-1 inhibitor, and Yervoy, which is known as a CTLA-4 inhibitor, are approved to treat melanoma. Bristol is also testing the regimen in other cancers.Merck, on the other hand, has worked to combine Keytruda with chemotherapy. U.S. regulators approved the combination as a first treatment for advanced lung cancer. Merck is also studying Keytruda with another investigational PD-1 inhibitor called MK-3475.On Friday, analysts were less bullish on Incyte's shot with epacadostat, but do see some value for Incyte's other drugs including baricitinib, a rheumatoid arthritis drug with Eli Lilly (LLY), and cancer drug ruxolitinib, branded as Jakafi and Jakavi.Raymond James' Benjamin kept his outperform rating on Incyte. He sees Incyte's Jakafi generating $2.5 billion to $3 billion by 2027. It also has the potential to book significant royalties from baricitinib as well as ruxolitinib outside the U.S., which is also sold by Novartis (NVS) as Jakavi.RBC analyst Brian Abrahams chopped his price target on Incyte to 75 from 114, completely discounting epacadostat. He still has an outperform rating on the stock. Like Raymond James' Benjamin, he still sees some value for Jakafi and baricitinib. But he expects Incyte to terminate other epacadostat studies."Only silver lining in our view is that (the) results were unequivocal and should make future decisions clear," he said in a note. "Based on the data we see very low likelihood any robust signals in biomarker-defined subgroups emerge that would support continuing anything other than studies substantially reduced in scope for exploratory purposes."RELATED:How To Build Long-Term Profits In Stocks? Take Many Gains At 20%-25%Investing Basics: How To Sell A StockLooking For The Best Stocks To Buy And Watch? Start Here

The stock market sold off sharply Friday as three-session win streaks for the major stock indexes came to an abrupt end.Negative sentiment in the stock market was fueled after President Trump threatened another $100 billion of tariffs on China imports.Investors weren't overly fearful, though. The put-call ratio registered a tame reading of 1.04. Excessive fear has been seen at many market bottoms in the past.At the close, the Dow Jones industrial average, S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite showed losses of around 2.2% to 2.3%. Small caps also took heat as the Russell 2000 gave back 2%. Preliminary data showed volume coming in higher than Thursday's levels. Can someone with just a little savings learn to master the market and turn that hard-earned cash into something substantial? Absolutely.One secret ingredient? Discipline. Ingredient No. 2? Concentration. No. 3? A full understanding and conviction in IBD's seven-point investment system, CAN SLIM.Discipline means focusing your cash in the very best stocks, the ones that rise a lot and rise fast. These market lions enjoy long-term buying from institutions. IBD calls this accumulation.The big boys and the big girls move stock prices on Wall Street. Mutual fund companies, large hedge funds and registered investment advisors with hundreds of millions, even billions to invest, seem to have the advantage. Yet an individual investor can still make money. Follow the CAN SLIM system, invented by IBD chairman and founder Bill O'Neil, of selecting, buying and selling stocks, to a T.Note that the I in this seven-letter acronym stands for institutional sponsorship and strong demand. Avoid the penny stocks with bombastic promises from its promoters. Smart fund managers don't buy junk. Seek the high-quality names that the best funds are buying, and you boost your chances of making money.Harness the power of growth stock screens such as the IBD 50, Sector Leaders, IPO Leaders, Global Leaders or Big Cap 20. None of the companies trade below $10 a share. A high price is a badge of quality; a high share price also allows funds to deploy a lot of capital more quickly.Don't let a share price of $50, $100 or more stop you from seeking shares in the best quality companies at the right time. The number of shares you buy does not matter. And this is where the second ingredient — concentration — comes in. An investor with up to $5,000 to invest should really invest only in one or two names at a time.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseBuying eight or 10 stocks cost dearly in trading commissions. The impact by just one of those stocks will be limited. Eight to 10 stocks makes sense in an account of say, $200,000, $500,000 or more, and when the market is in a strong uptrend.By owning just one or two stocks, you must cut losses short, at 7% or less. We call this the golden rule of investing.Doing so keeps you in the Wall Street game. Several winners that rise 20%, 40%, 100% or more will more than offset the bad trades.Let's say you opened a $2,500 account at the start of 2017. You come across one of the year's top Chinese consumer spending plays, TAL Education (TAL), No. 37 in the IBD 50 in the IBD Weekly newspaper edition for the week of Jan. 23. The "Inside The IBD 50" column noted TAL as the biggest gainer, up 7.2% in the week ended Jan. 20.You buy 190 shares as it breaks out of a base, an 11-week double bottom with handle, at 13.07 (adjusted for a 6-for-1 stock split) on Jan. 19. That $2,483.30 investment (190 x 13.07) would have grown into $3,368.70 by the close on March 24 as the cram school operator rises 36%.TAL sets up again. It forms a five-week flat base. You go in again, buying 149 shares as the small-cap growth firm rushes past a 22.44 buy point on July 17. By TAL's recent close at 32.92, that $3,343.56 stake is now up to $4,905.08. With just two buys, your portfolio has nearly doubled in value, minus commissions.No one is perfect. Let's say you had two duds after the first score. If you kept losses small at 7%, you still would have had around $2,928 to invest in TAL for the next big move.A version of this column was first published on Sept. 15, 2017.(Please follow Saito-Chung on Twitter at @IBD_DChung for additional commentary on big growth stocks, breakouts, sell signals, and financial markets. Also, you can trade the IBD 50 inexpensively and via one click with the Innovator IBD 50 (FFTY) exchange-traded fund, managed by Innovator Capital.)RELATED:Stocks Near A Buy ZoneWhich Companies Are Now Featured In IBD Leaderboard?When To Sell A Stock: Take Many Gains When Your Profit Reaches This LevelHow To Make A Million Dollars In Stocks: Why Any Open-Minded Youth Can Achieve It

Walmart (WMT) has reportedly inked a deal with Tencent Holdings' (TCEHY) WeChat in western China, ditching Alibaba's (BABA) Alipay, as mobile payments quickly replace cash in the country.Telling Reuters that it was a "business decision" to improve customer experience, a Walmart spokesperson said that the mega-retailer will, down the road, "cooperate with more partners to provide payment solutions with more convenience and benefits."Alibaba, the biggest online retailer in China, also has a No. 1 player in its Alipay system, which is comparable to Apple (AAPL) Pay.The move further positions Walmart on the side of Alibaba's rivals in the country. Walmart doubled its stake in China's second-biggest e-commerce player, JD.com (JD), to 10.8% in late 2016. WeChat operator Tencent is JD.com's largest stakeholder. Together, Tencent and JD.com acquired a 12.5% stake in smaller online competitor Vipshop (VIPS) in December.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseWalmart shares fell 1.7% to 86.05 on the stock market today, below their 200-day average after breaching their 50-day last month. Alibaba sank 4.5%, Tencent lost 3.3%, and JD.com eased 2.7%.IBD'S TAKE: With thousands of publicly traded companies to choose from, how can you quickly find the best stocks to buy right now? A good starting point is to regularly review screens that highlight the top-rated equities.Domestically, Walmart is engaged with its own battle against Amazon and other major retailers, and shares dove over 10% after reporting a fourth quarter that reflected slowing online sales growth.Walmart's e-commerce head Marc Lore said at retail conference Shoptalk last week that the slowdown had been "largely planned," and reiterated that he would stay on at the company and has committed to five years there.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Startups Join Online Grocery Fray As Walmart Hits The StreetsMacy's Debuts In-Store Mobile Checkout In Amazon RebuttalAmazon Vs. Gaming revenue in Macau, the world's biggest market for the industry, rose 5.7% in February, missing expectations. Shares of casino and resort giants Las Vegas Sands (LVS), Wynn Resorts (WYNN), MGM Resorts International (MGM) and Melco Resorts & Entertainment (MLCO) initially held up near key support levels, but tumbled with the broader market.X The results come after casino sales jumped 36.4% higher in January, followed by an 11-month streak of double-digit sales gains last year. Those figures marked the best year-over-year increase since 2014, when a regulatory crackdown spooked VIP customers and weighed on revenue.For February of this year, analysts had expected a 9.9% revenue gain, according to Consensus Metrix.Melco Resorts fell 2.1% in the stock market today. Las Vegas Sands fell 2.7% and Wynn Resorts 2.4%.MGM Resorts, a more Las-Vegas-centric casino operator, retreated 2.8%. MGM recently opened a new location in Macau, a Chinese special administrative region and the only part of China where gambling is legal.All four stocks are trading further below their 50-day moving averages, with MGM approaching its 200-day line.Macau's results follow a tumultuous past few months for the casino business.Steve Wynn resigned as Wynn Resorts' CEO following allegations of sexual misconduct. Those allegations also prompted regulators in Macau, Massachusetts and Nevada to review the matter. Shortly before the allegations surfaced, Wynn reported earnings that nearly tripled on solid Macau revenue.IBD'S TAKE: Buying or holding a stock can be risky heading into an earnings report. Here's an earnings options strategy that can help you cash in on post-earnings stock gains, while minimizing the risk from a weak quarter.Penn National Gaming (PENN), meanwhile, said a mass shooting in Las Vegas in October left business at its Tropicana resort "very challenged."MGM and Boyd Gaming (BYD) both turned out quarterly results that missed estimates last month, and MGM forecast lower Q1 revenue on the Las Vegas Strip due to difficult comparisons for its conventions business and construction disruption at Monte Carlo.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Ford Mixed, Las Vegas Sands Beats, United Rental Profit MeetsCould Wynn Resorts Be Sold In Wake Of CEO's Sexual-Misconduct Allegations?NBA Backs Nationwide Sports Betting — For This Price

Market-leading education firms TAL Education Group (TAL) and New Oriental Education (EDU) fell sharply down Monday amid political developments in their home country of China.X Meanwhile another Chinese company, Sunlands Online Education Group, has filed for a U.S. listing in an IPO that could raise up to $300 million, according to Chinese news organization Caixin.TAL, which is ranked No. 14 on the IBD 50, fell 5.25% to close at 36.81 on the stock market today, but closing above a 36.26 buy point cleared last week. New Oriental dropped 4.1% to 92.02, diving below its 50-day line. They are two of the top three performing stocks in the Consumer Services-Education group as measured by Composite Rating.Other Chinese education companies also slipped but not as much, with Rise Education (REDU) finishing down 3.4% and Tarena International (TEDU) dipping 0.5%. Among Chinese tech giants, Alibaba (BABA) edged up 0.5%, Weibo (WB) sank 5%, Sina (SINA) lost 2.5%, and Baidu (BIDU) gained 2.2%. TAL and Weibo were in Monday's IBD Stock Spotlight screen.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseAccording to IBD Stock Checkup, the TAL's Accumulation/Distribution Rating is a B+, indicating strong institutional demand over the last quarter. However, it was coming out of a later-stage base, having advanced more than 200% in 2017 alone. Later-stage bases are more likely to fail than earlier-stage formations.The falls come as investors keep a wary eye on political developments in economic powerhouse China. The ruling Communist Party put forward a proposal Sunday to remove the constitutional clause that sets the term limit on presidents to two terms in office.It is widely seen as a move to allow President Xi Jinping to stay in office indefinitely. While this could bring short-term benefits by bringing political continuity as the country works toward economic reforms, it also presents major risks in the longer term as it will allow Xi to tighten his grip on power.There is also uncertainty surrounding the administration of the stock market itself, with China's top securities regulator, Liu Shiyu, last week proposing to delay a deadline for the government to authorize a registration-based IPO mechanism until February 2020. The original deadline would expire on Feb. 28 of this year.The country announced plans in 2015 to shift to a U.S.-style registration system for stock-market flotations on the Shanghai and Shenzhen exchanges, but the National People's Congress has yet to approve the reform proposal.IBD'S TAKE: If you want to understand the state of the market, pay attention to the major averages and leading stocks. Read IBD's Stock Market Today columns throughout the market day, and the end-of-day The Big Picture (take a free trial) for timely market analysis and highlighted growth stocks breaking out of proper bases. TAL's dip comes despite a sunny outlook overall for the stock. In the most recent quarter — reported Jan. 25 — it saw a 125% earnings boost vs. the year-ago period, while revenue growth came in at 66%. Consensus estimates expect the firm's earnings to grow 14% in fiscal 2018 ending in February and 62% in 2019.The Chinese K-12 after-school tutoring market is expected to grow 15% annually until 2020, which bodes well for the space's leader, TAL Education.And earlier this month the firm signed an agreement with Oxford University Press that aims to bolster teacher training. TAL is to set up the Xueersi English Overseas Academic Research Institute in the English city of Oxford, which will focus on developing teachers' skills and improving learning content.By way of contrast, New Oriental missed fiscal second-quarter earnings estimates, but revenue and revenue guidance topped forecasts. The company earned nine cents a share adjusted, up 8%. Revenue rose 37% to $467.2 million. New Oriental was expected to report fiscal Q2 earnings of 11 cents a share, up 37.5%. Revenue is seen rising 34% to $464.05 million. Student enrollments rose 43% to 1.877 million.But the outlook was more positive, with New Oriental seeing current Q3 revenue of $591.1 million to $604.2 million. That's above the current consensus for $580.17 million.Meanwhile, Sunlands Online Education Group, which was founded in 2003, filed for a U.S. listing on Friday. The firm began as a traditional education company before transitioning four years ago to an online-focused business model. It now serves some 550,000 students."The online education model has transformed the postsecondary and professional education market in China," Sunlands said in its IPO prospectus filed on Friday. "It has made a tremendous number of students aware of the more flexible, cost-effective education solutions provided by online education. We expect that this trend will continue to drive further demand for such services and result in online education providers taking market share away from traditional offline players."China's private-education programs are on the road to becoming a bigger, more competitive business thanks to a growing population of primary-school-age students and rising disposable income in big cities like Beijing and Shanghai.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Is Trump's National Security Strategy On A Collision Path With Xi's China Vision?Best Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchWhich Stocks Are Showing Rising Relative Strength?Stocks To Buy And Watch: Top IPOs, Big And Small Caps, Growth Stocks

Stocks opened to moderate gains Wednesday, as early earnings news and positive fourth-quarter consumer price and spending revisions fueled early gains.X Art market site Etsy (ETSY) notched a breakout at the open, as an Amazon.com (AMZN) acquisition and a pending spin-off from China-based Baidu (BIDU) also helped energize early trade.The Nasdaq Composite popped 0.4% at the start of trade as Apple (AAPL) and three of four FANG stock tech leaders posted early gains. The Dow Jones industrial average jumped almost 0.4%, with Boeing (BA) and Verizon (VZ) leading the index. The S&P 500 opened 0.3% higher, as heavy early losses from Lowe's (LOW), Celgene (CELG) and Discovery Communications (DISCA) held back early action.Markets across Asia took a beating Wednesday as investors reacted to comments made Tuesday by U.S. Fed chief Jerome Powell and to weaker-than-expected manufacturing data out of China. Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index dived 1.4%, the Shanghai Composite slipped 1% and, in Japan, Tokyo's Nikkei 225 dumped 1.4%.Stocks in Europe turned mixed afternoon trade. The CAC-40 in Paris and London's FTSE 100 both reversed early losses and clung to fractional gains.The Commerce Department kept its estimate for fourth-quarter GDP growth essentially unchanged, at 2.5%, vs. its initial estimate of a 2.6% gain. The number was what economists largely expected. Wednesday's report also eased the price growth estimate a notch, to 2.3%, down from 2.4%— that was below expectations for no change, and eased some pressure on interest rates. Consumer spending was unchanged, up 3.8%, above forecasts for 3.7% growth, also a positive.Kingsbury International releases its Chicago Purchasing Managers Index at 9:45 a.m. ET, followed by January pending home sales data from the National Association of Realtors and the Energy Information Administration's weekly oil inventory estimates.Verizon and Boeing each jumped more than 1% to take an early lead among Dow Jones stocks. Verizon has been struggling to regain support at its 10-week moving average since Feb. 21. Boeing is extended, in a profit taking zone above a September breakout.Etsy rocketed 21% higher after reporting a fourth-quarter earnings surge of 179% and a third straight quarter of revenue growth acceleration late Tuesday. Total value of goods sold during the quarter topped $1 billion for the first time. The high-volume gain left shares beyond buy range above a 21.96 buy point in a second-stage cup base.Weight Watchers (WTW) swept up 7% after reporting a 63% earnings gain and a 16% rise in revenue, both above consensus views. Management also raised its full-year earnings guidance to well above expectations, and announced it's shifting its focus from diet to overall health, aiming to become "a partner in health and wellness." The stock is extended, in a profit-taking zone after clearing a cup-with-handle base in January.Booking Holdings (BKNG) grabbed an 9% opening gain. The travel deals site formerly known as Priceline Group reported a stronger-than-expected fourth-quarter performance late Tuesday. The breakout gain put shares in a buy range above an 1984.10 buy point in a first stage cup-with-handle base.Daqo New Energy (DQ) dropped 4% higher in early trade. The China-based polysilicon maker's fourth-quarter sales and earnings cleared analyst targets by wide margins. The stock has been battling resistance at its 10-week moving average, as it attempts to build the right side of a possible base.On the downside, Lowe's dive 8% after a mixed fourth-quarter report showed fourth-quarter earnings and full-year earnings guidance below consensus estimates. Shares have been fighting since early February tbayryo climb back on their 10-week moving average and build the right side of a possible base.Amazon.com confirmed late Tuesday it was preparing to acquire video security and doorbell maker Ring, in a deal reportedly worth more than $1 billion. The deal for the Santa Monica, Calif.-based outfit would be Amazon's second-largest to date, and would bolster Amazon's efforts to expand home security measures related to package theft. Amazon shares are extended, and in a profit-taking zone after clearing a flat base in January.News reports said European Union regulators were set to approve, with conditions, the $62.5 billion acquisition of U.S.-based Monsanto (MON) by Germany's Bayer (BAYRY). Monsanto shares rose 0.6%.China-based search engine Baidu traded 0.8% higher after its streaming video services unit iQiyi registered on Tuesday to spin out in a U.S. IPO. The streaming service, which offers both free and subscription-based content, aims to raise $1.5 billion. It will trade on the Nasdaq as IQ.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:The Big Picture: Inflation Fears Jolt Stocks; Here's The Silver Lining This Top Stock Just Triggered A Sell Signal On Weak GuidanceShale Leader Crushes Views, Hikes Dividend, Sees $1 Billion Capex BumpSalesforce, Crocs, Monster, Lowe's, TJX Lead Investing Action Plan

Exelixis (EXEL) and Clovis Oncology (CLVS) shares diverged Tuesday after each reported lackluster sales of their biggest cancer drugs in the fourth quarter.On the stock market today, Exelixis plunged 8.2% to close at 27.11. Clovis shares, on the other hand, popped 6.6% to finish at 59.15.Analysts expect Clovis to grab approval for a second maintenance drug in ovarian cancer, helping it to compete against AstraZeneca (AZN) and Tesaro (TSRO). Exelixis' Cabometyx is still in the early days following approval as a first treatment in some kidney cancer patients."We think U.S. approval of Rubraca in the broad second-line maintenance indication is an important growth driver for the product which has a competitive profile, according to physicians we surveyed in November," Leerink analyst Michael Schmidt said in a note to clients.Meanwhile, Exelixis reported $90.4 million in Cabometyx sales during its fourth quarter. That lagged the consensus for $98 million, RBC analyst Kennen MacKay wrote in his report to clients. This was the result of inventory drawdown and seasonal profit headwinds.MacKay called the miss "unexpected," noting he had modeled 16% growth based on the number of Cabometyx prescriptions written in the fourth quarter vs. the third quarter."However, we view the fourth quarter as a transitional quarter with minimal impact from the Dec. 19 approval of Cabometyx in first-line renal cell carcinoma (kidney cancer)," he said. "We see this indication driving the Cabometyx franchise."Cabometyx has grown its market share to 24% and tacked on 21% prescription growth in the first six weeks of 2018. This is "indicative of a very strong launch in first-line renal cell carcinoma," MacKay said.Piper Jaffray analyst Edward Tenthoff forecasts Cabometyx penetrating 10% of the first-line renal cell carcinoma market. He expects 10% growth of Cabometyx as a treatment for kidney cancer that doesn't respond to other therapies.Track Top Stocks And Market Trends With Free IBD Newsletters"Importantly, Exelixis continues to invest in Cabometyx clinical development with now around 70 studies ongoing, including immuno-oncology combinations," he said in a note.Exelixis is facing off against Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY), which is combining its checkpoint inhibitors Opdivo and Yervoy to treat the same population of kidney cancer patients. The Food and Drug Administration will consider Bristol's regimen in April.A recent trial showed Bristol's combination wasn't as effective in a group of patients with less of a key protein in their bodies. This should help Cabometyx, Tenthoff said."Cabometyx should capture checkpoint failures, potentially expanding the currently addressable population," he said. "More important, Cabometyx could ultimately compete in first-line renal cell carcinoma."Rubraca brought in $17 million in fourth-quarter sales, flat and lagging the consensus for $19 million, RBC's MacKay wrote. But investors' focus is still on Rubraca getting approval as a second, maintenance treatment in ovarian cancer.This is "where we anticipate the drug can be competitive," MacKay said.Clovis' Rubraca, along with drugs from AstraZeneca and Tesaro, are known as PARP inhibitors. They are being used to treat ovarian cancer, but have shown some promise as potential treatments in breast and prostate cancers.Rubraca was the first of the trio to get approval as a third treatment in a specific group of ovarian cancer patients. But AstraZeneca and Tesaro later got approval in the earlier and broader second-line maintenance population of ovarian cancer patients.The FDA is set to examine Rubraca as a second-line maintenance ovarian-cancer therapy in April. Leerink's Schmidt still sees Rubraca as capable of gaining a third of that market based on the strength of its clinical trial data.Further, Rubraca continues to maintain a leadership opportunity in a form of prostate cancer — "the next large commercial opportunity for PARP inhibitors," Schmidt said.RELATED:Cancer Biotech Plunges Despite Narrowly Beating Quarterly Sales ViewsBiogen's Multiple Sclerosis Drug Franchise Takes Another HitCan CRISPR And These 3 Small Biotechs Cure 10,000 Diseases?

Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA) continued its two-day upswing Friday after announcing the launch of a generic version of a drug from Gilead Sciences (GILD), a day after the drugmaker unveiled a massive cost-cutting plan.X In afternoon trading on the stock market today, Teva lifted 6.2%, near 18.40. Earlier, the stock popped as much as 8.1%. Shares closed up 10.2% on Thursday, the day Teva said it would cut $3 billion by the end of 2019 to deal with its debt.Gilead's drug, Viread, is approved to treat HIV and hepatitis B in some patients. Teva is launching a generic version of Viread 300-milligram tablets in the U.S. in the hopes of taking a chunk of the $762 million in annual U.S. sales Viread garnered as of October.There are an estimated 1.1 million and 850,000 people living in the U.S. with HIV and chronic hepatitis B, respectively, who could benefit from Viread, Teva said in a news release. The launch adds to Teva's generic portfolio of nearly 600 medications.On Monday, Teva also announced its launch of a generic version of Viagra, which is branded by Dow stock Pfizer (PFE). As of August, the erectile dysfunction drug had annual sales of $1.4 billion in the U.S., Teva said in a news release.Goldman Sachs analyst Jami Rubin praised Teva for its plans to cut $3 billion in costs over the next two years. The cuts will come in the form of layoffs, closing manufacturing facilities and suspending its dividends on ordinary shares.IBD'S TAKE: Teva has an IBD Composite Rating of 14 out of a best-possible 99, meaning it underperforms the lion's share of stocks in terms of key growth metrics. But other generic drug stocks have stronger ratings like Ani Pharmaceuticals, which comes in at 97. Head to IBD Stock Checkup for a look at other strong players in the generic-drug landscape.Rubin had initially expected Teva to announce a plan to cut $1 billion to $2 billion in costs by 2020. She expects New Chief Executive Kare Schultz to deliver on his promises based on a background at Lundbeck where he "repeatedly understated and overdelivered.""We acknowledge there is investor skepticism around the health of the base business, but note this is the first time in a while where we have seen a concrete strategy towards de-levering the company, which is a top priority," she said in a note to clients.The conference call on Thursday suggests a weaker base for earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, but this will be more than offset by cost contribution, Rubin said.As part of the restructuring, Teva is combining its generics and specialty units, and will focus its efforts in the U.S., Europe and emerging markets. Rubin sees drugs in migraines and involuntary movements tied to Huntington's disease as leading Teva's specialty unit.Rubin acknowledges this could create additional downside risk to Teva's top line, but sees the exit from unprofitable businesses as a potential mark for the bottoming of U.S. generic pricing."We are not calling the bottom yet, however, but will closely monitor the rate and magnitude of rationalization efforts as important sign posts," she said.She boosted her price target on Teva to 20 from 15 and upgraded the stock to a buy rating from neutral.RELATED:Teva Pharma Announces Layoffs, Suspends Dividends To Tackle DebtWhy Amgen Could Have An Edge Over These Rivals In Preventing MigrainesTeva's Restructuring Plan: Another Case Of Been Here, Done That?

Savvy investors search for themes that can lead to strong, long-term profits. Will India be one for years to come?XIt sure seems so. The large democracy hosts a young population. Entrepreneurship is rising. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has driven meaningful tax and currency reforms to encourage competition, boost inter-regional commerce, and encourage direct investment.One key reform: the GST (Goods and Services Tax), meant to replace the dizzying array of local taxes that vary from region to region."It is something that will really change the history of India," Paul P. John, president of the eponymous high-quality single malt whisky distiller based in Goa, told IBD. Paul John, started in 1992, produces 10 million cases of whisky each year as well as brandy and wine.Ask investing veterans and you'll find plenty of optimism.Mohnish Pabrai, managing partner of Irvine, Calif.-based $705 million Pabrai Investment Funds, notes that 55% of the country's people are under the age of 30. Hundreds of millionaires are under 40."What really surprised me is the number of good entrepreneurs and CEOs that I have met there," said Pabrai, author of "The Dhando Investor." His flagship fund PIF 2 is up 56.8% year to date through Sept. 30. "Of the 5,000 publicly traded companies in India, around 1,000 are really good. It's a very big base. These guys are not only going for it, but they underestimate the tailwind that's going for them."Pabrai, who visits his native homeland often to study investing opportunities, notes only 3% of the citizens participate directly in the stock market. "Even though the Indian equity markets are at record highs, I am still finding the occasional deeply undervalued security in India. I love what we own in India," Pabrai wrote in a recent note to clients.The Bombay Stock Exchange's S&P BSE Sensex benchmark trades near 33,053, up 24% since Jan. 1.Finding top Indian firms may be tough if you do not have direct access to the Bombay Stock Exchange. Today, few Indian ADRs trade on Wall Street. This year, business process outsourcing play WNS Holdings (WNS) (98 Composite Rating on IBD Stock Checkup) and HDFC Bank (HDB) (91 Composite) are the only Indian ADRs that get a Composite of 90 or higher. Tata Motors (TTM), which owns the Jaguar and Land Rover brands, holds a lousy 28 Composite.High net worth investors can participate in the Pabrai and similar hedge funds. Others can buy a top mutual fund that specializes in India. Check out the $231 million Wasatch Emerging India fund (WAINX) and $2.3 billion Matthews India Fund (MINDX). The former shows an average annual total return of 15.68% over five years through Sept. 30; the latter is up 14.96%."The new tax regime is already speeding up the flow of goods throughout India by eliminating time-consuming stops at various checkpoints," co-managers Ajay Krishnan and Matthew Dreith wrote in a recent report. "However, initial confusion over compliance details has offset some of GST's benefits in the short term, especially for small businesses."WisdomTree India Earnings (EPI), showcased in IBD's weekly ETF Leaders column on June 5, selects stocks that earned at least $5 million in the fiscal year before an annual reconstitution every September. The minimum market cap for each stock is $200 million.(Follow Saito-Chung on Twitter for more analysis and commentary on the stock market and growth stocks at @IBD_DChung.)RELATED:The Latest In ETF And Fund NewsHow Can You Finding Leading ETFs?Can You Make A Million Dollars Trading ETFs? Yes, Here's HowIBD Global Stock Leaders

Cellectis (CLLS) popped early Wednesday after it and Dow's Pfizer (PFE) presented strong data for the first in-human trials of a cancer therapy at the American Society of Hematology conference.X By the closing bell on the stock market today, Cellectis had leapt 11.6% to finish at 26.80, after earlier rising as much as 18.5%, near a five-week high. Pfizer advanced 0.2%, near 36.64.The Phase 1 studies tested a drug known as UCART19 in adult and pediatric patients with a form of acute lymphoblastic leukemia that either relapsed or didn't respond to other methods of treatment.Collectively, patients achieved an 83% remission rate across both populations. Five out of seven adult patients achieved remission with no evidence of disease in the blood cells or bone marrow at day 28 after treatment with UCART19, Cellectis said in a news release.Only one case of graft-vs.-host disease occurred and there were no instances of severe neurotoxicity. One patient developed severe cytokine release syndrome, characterized by flu-like symptoms, and died. This was previously reported, Instinet analyst Christoper Marai said in a report to clients.IBD'S TAKE: Earlier in the week, several biotechs popped following presentations at the American Society of Hematology. Follow their news by visiting IBD Industry Themes.In the pediatric trial, all five children achieved minimal residual disease, enabling them to proceed to a stem cell transplant. There was only one case of graft-vs.-host disease and none of neurotoxicity. Cytokine release syndrome cases were mild and manageable.Marai views Cellectis' UCART platform to be "more fundamentally transformative to the cellular therapy space" than a new target for traditional CAR-T therapies. CAR-T therapy teaches a patient's immune system to fight cancer using specific targets in the body.Cellectis describes its UCART platform as a "frozen, off-the-shelf T-cell-based medicinal product." It is allogeneic rather than autologous, meaning the cells used are from a donor and produced for a wide population rather than directly from the patient."Fundamentally, the data presented established viability and success of allogeneic CAR-T, through a path to re-dosing and validation across multiple targets (which was previously thought to be impossible)," Marai said.He reiterated his buy rating and 43 price target on Cellectis.RELATED:Why This Biotech Stock Is Defying A Hematology-Related PitfallWhy Gilead Could Have 'Greatest' Ever In HIV Drug LaunchesAmazon Reportedly In Talks With Mylan, Novartis About Pharma Entry

JD.com (JD) and Alibaba Group (BABA) have a clear road ahead in dominating China's e-commerce market with Amazon.com (AMZN) continuing to be shut out, one analyst says.X Scott Devitt, a Stifel analyst, resumed coverage on JD.com with a buy rating and price target of 48 on U.S.-listed shares. JD.com climbed 5.8% to close at 40.80 on the stock market today."Third-party estimates call for e-commerce sales in China to surpass $1 trillion in 2019 — a 16% compound annual growth rate," Devitt said in a note to clients.JD.com is the second-largest e-commerce company in China measured by gross merchandise volume."Alibaba and JD.com are both well-managed and well-positioned. The two leaders have effectively shut Amazon out of the e-commerce market in the region. JD.com is the more structured player with controlled logistics," added Devitt.IBD'S TAKE: JD.com is up 58% in 2017 but shares have weakened since August. JD.com has a technical buy point of 49.09. Learn more about JD.com and other Chinese internet stocks at IBD Stock Checkup.In October, JD.com and Tencent Holdings (TCEHY) expanded their partnership with the launch of a retail marketing platform. JD.com also has an alliance with Wal-Mart (WMT), which sold its Chinese e-commerce operation to JD.com last year. Wal-Mart took a stake in JD.com as part of the transaction."We expect the primary growth drivers of the China e-commerce market to be improving delivery and payment capabilities, further expansion to rural markets, and a less-developed traditional retail landscape," added Devitt.RELATED:Here's How Target, Amazon Are Expanding Same-Day ShippingBest Chinese Stocks To Buy And WatchGoogle Opens China AI Research Center Amid TensorFlow Marketing PushIn AI Technology Race, U.S. Chips May Be Ace-In-The-Hole Vs. The International Energy Agency said 2018 "might not be quite so happy for OPEC producers" as U.S. output increases, but the agency expects a balanced market next year, with a supply deficit in the second half.X In its monthly report out Thursday, the IEA raised its 2017 growth forecast for U.S. crude by 390,000 barrels per day and by 870,000 bpd in 2018 vs. estimated production growth of 370,000 bpd this year and 790,000 bpd 2018 in the energy watchdog's November report."But 2018 as a whole is showing a closely balanced market," the IEA said.The agency sees a supply surplus of 200,000 bpd in the first half of the year but then a supply deficit of 200,000 in the second half.For three years, OPEC has struggled to rebalance markets amid a surge of U.S. shale output. The IEA's forecast is the latest indication that OPEC's goal may finally be within reach.But the IEA left global oil demand growth outlook unchanged 1.5 million bpd this year and at 1.3 million bpd next year.U.S. crude futures erased early losses to close up 0.8% to $57.04 a barrel.Exxon Mobil (XOM) shares were down 0.2% on the stock market today. Chevron (CVX) off 0.3%, BP (BP) fell 1 cent and Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) fell 0.4%.IBD'S TAKE: Read IBD's The Big Picture column each day to stay on top of the market direction, a key indicator that lets you know when you can be aggressive and when you should move to the sidelines.U.S. crude production has been surging and last week climbed to a record 9.780 million barrels per day from 9.707 million in the prior week, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration, which sees domestic output reaching 10 million barrels a day in 2018.OPEC needs a balanced market before it ends its current pact to cut remove 1.8 million barrels per day from the market.In its monthly report out Wednesday, OPEC said that it doesn't see oil markets balancing until late next year as shale drilling heats up, throwing into doubt recent talk of plotting an exit strategy from its production cuts.RELATED: Energy Stocks And Industry News: Oil, Gas, Solar, CoalOil Prices Reverse Lower Despite Key Pipeline Shutting Down

China tariffs announced by the White House on Thursday sent a shockwave across global stock markets, in a wildly complex news week for investors. Markets knew the import tariffs were coming. And it was also no surprise that, by late Thursday, China had begun to set out its own import tariff targets in a tit-for-tat response.On China's stock markets, the Shanghai composite ended the week down 3.6%, Hong Kong's Hang Seng dropped 3.8%, with both giving up attempts to retake support at their 50-day moving averages. In relation to their Jan. 29 highs, the Hang Seng ended down 9.5%, and the Shanghai composite had corrected 12%.China-based stocks, which are currently a relatively small portion of the overall growth stock lineup, were under clear pressure for the week. But only a few showed any real chart damage.While global stock markets fear a trade war, the White House's penalties on China were not so much tariffs as they were an intent to advance toward tariffs. President Trump gave U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer 15 days to construct a list of China-based products on which to impose tariffs.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseLighthizer is to seek input from companies and other government agencies in reviewing what is reportedly a list of 1,300 sorts of products from China. The final list aims to levy a reported $50 billion in annual trade penalties.The amount is roughly equivalent to the revenue the administration estimates U.S. companies in China lose each year as a result of forced technology transfers to local partners, according to an administration official quoted in Friday's South China Morning Post.The tactic is another instance of Trump's 'threaten, then bargain' approach to creating negotiating leverage. China's government provides the largest test so far for that strategy. Unlike Canada and Europe, China is also the first real non-democratic test for Trump's negotiating technique. In addition, the country also happens to be the largest holder of U.S. debt, and the largest buyer of U.S. Treasury bonds.These factors give a very trade-war savvy China broad flexibility in how it decides to respond to the U.S. trade-war threat.China has said it plans to challenge the tariffs by appeals through the World Trade Organization. But in an opening salvo on Thursday, it also imposed about $3 billion in tariffs on wine, fruit and almonds. Soybeans and other agricultural imports were previously named as retaliatory targets, as well as limiting U.S. companies' further access to financial markets.Among leading China-based stocks trading in the U.S., Baidu (BIDU) may have suffered some of the week's worst damage, diving almost 12%, to a test of support at its 40-week moving average. That puts the stock down 1% since the start of the year, and 15% below its March 12 high.RELATED:Stocks Dive On Trump Tariffs, But This Gauge Hints At BounceAfter Trump Tariffs Hit, China 'Not Afraid' To Fight Trade WarSteel Stocks Dive On Trump Tariff Exemptions As China Trade Is Top PriorityThe Trump Economy: Jobs, Regulations, Taxes And TradeFed Rate Hike Is No Surprise, But Stock Market Weakens On Powell, 2019 Outlook

Apple (AAPL) aims to catch-up in artificial intelligence as it has hired away the former head of AI and search technology from Google-parent Alphabet (GOOGL).John Giannandrea will report directly to Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook, according to the New York Times. Apple's voice-activated Siri search tools lag that of Amazon.com's (AMZN) Alexa as well as Google's digital assistant in consumer applications.Apple's move is the latest example of tech giants luring away top AI talent. The companies are rushing to improve a wide range of existing products with AI tools. AI programs — essentially computer algorithms — analyze huge amounts of data to identify patterns and predict outcomes.Amazon and Google lead on sales of smart home devices, though Apple still dominates the smartphone market. The digital assistants can help with shopping, entertainment, school work and other tasks. Apple was up 1.9% to close at 171.61 on the stock market today. Alphabet gained 1.1% to 1,029.71. Amazon climbed 1.3% to 1,410.57.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. One of them focuses on both cloud computing and AI.China's tech giants, meanwhile, have stepped up AI hiring. Microsoft's former executive vice president and top AI engineer, Qi Lu, is now Baidu's chief operating officer. Andrew Ng, formerly the founder of the Google Brain deep learning project, left as Baidu's chief scientist last year and now runs a venture capital fund focused on AI startups. YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Could This Hot Group Be The Tech Sector's New FANG Stocks?AI In Business: This Is What The Future HoldsChart-Reading Basics: How A Buy Point Marks A Time Of Real OpportunityLooking For The Best Stocks To Buy And Watch? Oil prices slipped on Wednesday, as worries of an escalating U.S.-China trade war weighed on the markets, even as the government reported that the nation's supply of crude fell last week.XThe Energy Information Administration said that commercial crude inventories fell by 4.6 million barrels during the week that ended March 30. Total motor gasoline supplies fell by 1.1 million barrels.Analysts had expected stockpiles to rise by 200,000 barrels, according to a Reuters poll.Domestic production rose by 27,000 barrels per day to 10.46 millions barrels a day.The American Petroleum Institute, an industry trade group, said on Tuesday that inventories dropped by 3.3 million barrels, while gasoline inventories rose by 1.1 million barrels, various reports said.The price of West Texas Intermediate crude dipped 0.2% to settle at $63.37 per barrel but had been down more than 2% earlier. Brent crude also lost 0.2%, closing at $68.02 a barrel.Exxon Mobil (XOM) closed down 0.2% in the stock market today, Chevron (CVX) lost 0.3%. BP (BP) rose 0.8%, and Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) added 0.7%.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe figures come as dueling forces push against oil prices. A U.S. shale boom has tamped down the increase in oil prices. However, OPEC has agreed to cut output, via a pact with Russia and nonmembers, in attempt to push prices higher.That deal expires at the end of this year. On Tuesday, Russian Energy Minster Alexander Novak said a joint group for cooperation between OPEC member and nonmember nations could be formed once that agreement ends, Reuters said. A Reuters survey also found that OPEC's oil output slid to its lowest point in 11 months.During the prior week, which ended on March 23, oil inventories rose by 1.6 million barrels.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Biggest Permian Buyout May Signal New Phase In Top Shale PlayCrude Oil Prices Are Up Sharply, But Is The Bakken Shale Play Back?OPEC Wants Long-Term Oil Production Pact With Russia

Shares of major video game publishers recovered from a fall Wednesday amid continued concerns that free-to-play game "Fortnite Battle Royale" is drawing away gamer time and money.Shares of Activision Blizzard (ATVI), Electronic Arts (EA) and Take-Two Interactive Software (TTWO) all were headed south before market momentum helped lift them on the stock market today. Activision shares ended the day 1.2% higher to close at 66.27. EA ticked up 0.5% to close at 120.11, while Take-Two managed to gain 1.2% to 96.96.But the trio of game stocks may face some headwinds. KeyBanc Capital Markets analyst Evan Wingren on Wednesday lowered his sales and earnings estimates for Activision, EA and Take-Two for the first half of 2018. He based his findings on proprietary survey results that show "Fortnite," from privately held Epic Games, is impacting their results."Proprietary data suggests 'Fortnite' is growing rapidly year over year, but month-to-month gains are slowing," Wingren said in a note to clients. "Clearly the game is affecting publishers to some degree, and we continue to view it as a risk to upside for consensus numbers in aggregate."Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseWingren rates Activision, EA and Take-Two stocks as overweight.KeyBanc's survey found that 30% of gamers play "Fortnite Battle Royale." "Fortnite" players listed "Call of Duty" from Activision and "Grand Theft Auto" from Take-Two as their other most-played games, KeyBanc said.Among "Fortnite" players, 74% said they are playing their other favorite games less. And since 71% of those players regularly purchase in-game items for their favorite games, that means less spending for the "Fortnite" rivals, Wingren said."Fortnite Battle Royale" is a 100-player online game where virtual combatants fight to the death to be the last person standing. The game is free to play, but the publisher sells digital extras that enhance the experience.Tencent Holdings (TCEHY) reportedly has a 49% stake in "Fortnite" publisher Epic Games.RELATED:Activision, EA, Take-Two Pressured By 'Fortnite' Popularity

Facebook (FB) Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg is set to begin testifying on Capitol Hill Tuesday on recent privacy issues that have troubled the social media giant.XOn Tuesday, Zuckerberg will face a joint hearing of the Senate Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation committees, scheduled to start at 2:15 p.m. ET. The event will be livestreamed here. He'll testify again on Wednesday before the House Energy and Commerce Committee, starting at 10 a.m. ET, livestreamed here.Overall, the hearings could result in a titanic political struggle over regulating social media companies, including Twitter (TWTR) and the YouTube unit of Alphabet (GOOGL)."Our joint hearing will be a public conversation with the CEO of this powerful and influential company about his vision for addressing problems that have generated significant concern about Facebook's role in our democracy, bad actors using the platform, and user privacy," U.S. Sen. John Thune, R-S.D., said in a statement. "With all of the data exchanged over Facebook and other platforms, users deserve to know how their information is shared and secured."Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseIn November, officials from Facebook, Twitter and Google testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee about Russian efforts to spread disinformation during the 2016 campaign. The three companies acknowledged their platforms had hosted disinformation campaigns carried out by Russian state actors.This week's hearings are expected to be media spectacles, with wall-to-wall coverage. They occur as the three companies also have to deal with Europe's new General Data Protection Regulation that takes effect May 25.As the 33-year-old Zuckerberg heads to Capitol Hill for the first time, he'll be grilled on the Cambridge Analytica scandal, where personal information on 87 million users could have been wrongfully obtained without their knowledge. Zuckerberg also is expected to be grilled on Russian attempts to sway the 2016 election, as well as content categorized as fake news, propaganda and hate speech.Zuckerberg apologized for the transgressions in a written statement he will present at the start of Wednesday's hearing. He said Facebook made a "big mistake" regarding issues of user privacy and meddling in the 2016 election."We didn't take a broad enough view of our responsibility, and that was a big mistake," Zuckerberg said in his prepared remarks to the House committee. "It was my mistake, and I'm sorry. I started Facebook, I run it, and I'm responsible for what happens here."He'll also likely be questioned on Russian attempts to sway the 2016 election, in addition to content categorized as fake news, propaganda and hate speech.While his testimony certainly contains risks, it's an opportunity for Zuckerberg to convince lawmakers he recognizes Facebook's responsibility and impact on society. He can try to persuade them he's got it all under control. Facebook stock could fluctuate, depending on how he performs. Zuckerberg has been preparing with Facebook's Washington team who have urged him to be humble, according to The New York Times.Facebook stock was up 2%, near 161, during morning trading on the stock market today. Its stock is down 13% since March 16. That's when media reports first revealed the Cambridge Analytica scandal. Alphabet stock, down 9% since March 16, were trading near 1,029, up 1%. Twitter, down 20% since the scandal broke, was up 2.6%, near 28.80.Facebook on Monday also announced the establishment of a panel of independent scholars. The group plans to provide "credible research about the role of social media in elections, as well as democracy more (in) general," the announcement said.On Tuesday, Twitter announced it would back the Honest Ads Act, a bill promoting political ad transparency. The Honest Ads Act, which Facebook has also endorsed, is a Senate bill introduced last year with bipartisan co-sponsors. It would subject online political ads to the same kind of disclosure rules used used in TV and other media.YOU MIGHT ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Mark Zuckerberg, The Facebook Data Breach And The Dark Side Of Social MediaFacebook's Zuckerberg Admits Big Mistake, Apologizes For ScandalFacebook Gets Price-Target Cut As Risks To Stock Persist Over Data ScandalFacebook Dives As Data Debacle Highlights 'Systemic' Risks
